column1: Voor een van onze opdrachtgevers in de Randstad zijn we op zoek naar een Data Analyst. Onze klant is op zoek naar een Data Analyst om samen te werken met een uitstekend Data team. Het zal jouw missie zijn om data tot leven te brengen met visuele inzichten om begrip, experimenteren en verandering te stimuleren. Jouw leiderschap en de structuren die je implementeert zullen helpen om alles te vormen, van digitale ontwikkeling tot marketingplannen. We hebben een data visionair nodig, kan jij die rol op je nemen?

Als onderdeel van het Data-team werk je met een aantal van de meest innovatieve technologieën. Dat betekent dat aandacht voor detail essentieel is. In deze functie ben je verantwoordelijk voor de analyse van digitale prestaties. Onze eindklant is op zoek naar een expert op het gebied van inzichten halen uit data. Je bent een netwerker en vindt snel je weg binnen een organisatie. Dankzij jouw analytische vaardigheden ben je in staat cijfermatige gegevens te analyseren en te interpreteren. Je hebt een sterk conceptueel vermogen, hierdoor zie je structuren en verbanden tussen verschillende vraagstukken.
Wat heb je nodig als Data Analyst?
Bachelor- of master diploma in IT, analytics (informatica, wiskunde), marketing/ communicatie
Drie jaar ervaring in e-commerce, digital marketing, digital analytics, business intelligence of conversie optimalisatie rol
Ervaring met datavisualisatie of dashboarding tools (Google Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI
Het vertalen van data naar bruikbare inzichten
Een laptop en iPhone die ook privé gebruikt kunnen worden
Ben je op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging als Data Analyst of ken je iemand die in het profiel past?
Dan kun je contact opnemen met Dario Mulder via dario.mulder@darwinrecruitment.com of bel naar: +31(0)20 305 85 59.
Darwin Recruitment is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Data Analyst

Voor een van onze opdrachtgevers in de Randstad zijn we op zoek naar een Data Analyst. Onze klant is op zoek naar een Data Analyst om samen te werken met een uitstekend Data team. Het zal jouw missie zijn om data tot leven te brengen met visuele inzichten om begrip, experimenteren en verandering te stimuleren. Jouw leiderschap en de structuren die je implementeert zullen helpen om alles te vormen, van digitale ontwikkeling tot marketingplannen. We hebben een data visionair nodig, kan jij die rol op je nemen?

De Functie als Data Analyst

Als onderdeel van het Data-team werk je met een aantal van de meest innovatieve technologieën. Dat betekent dat aandacht voor detail essentieel is. In deze functie ben je verantwoordelijk voor de analyse van digitale prestaties. Onze eindklant is op zoek naar een expert op het gebied van inzichten halen uit data. Je bent een netwerker en vindt snel je weg binnen een organisatie. Dankzij jouw analytische vaardigheden ben je in staat cijfermatige gegevens te analyseren en te interpreteren. Je hebt een sterk conceptueel vermogen, hierdoor zie je structuren en verbanden tussen verschillende vraagstukken.

Wat heb je nodig als Data Analyst?

Kennis van:

  • Bachelor- of master diploma in IT, analytics (informatica, wiskunde), marketing/ communicatie
column2: • Drie jaar ervaring in e-commerce, digital marketing, digital analytics, business intelligence of conversie optimalisatie rol
column3: • Ervaring met datavisualisatie of dashboarding tools (Google Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI
column4: • Ervaring met SQL of BigQuery
column5: • Ervaring met Python en R
column6: • Het vertalen van data naar bruikbare inzichten
column7:
Wat kan onze klant bieden?

  • Uitstekend basissalaris tot 75K op jaarbasis
column8: • 28+ Vakantiedagen
column9: • Flexibele werktijden
column10: • Een laptop en iPhone die ook privé gebruikt kunnen worden

4167045127,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-tpex-international-4167045127?position=2&pageNum=0&refId=vvRC1KbYFKLhk3N4GDxK%2BQ%3D%3D&trackingId=FRXLQdViz3L4mUZxy4fjgw%3D%3D,Data-analyst,TPEX International,"Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands","Profile Data Analyst

The data analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to provide valuable insights that support decision-making within the organization. This role requires an in-depth knowledge of data analysis techniques and tools.
TPEX and the Evolution towards Autonomous Buildings

At TPEX International, we strive to lead the evolution towards autonomous buildings. Our mission is to transform buildings into self-regulating, sustainable, and efficient environments through advanced technologies and innovative solutions.

Intelligent Systems: We integrate advanced systems capable of collecting and analyzing real-time data. These systems help optimize energy consumption, improve indoor climate, and minimize operational costs.
Digital Twins: By utilizing Digital Twins, we can create virtual models of our buildings. These models allow us to perform simulations, monitor performance, and plan proactive maintenance.
Automation: We develop and implement tools that automate various aspects of building management. This includes reading building data and directing suppliers based on this information.

Sustainability: Our commitment to sustainability remains a core value. By reducing waste and promoting a culture of sustainability, we aim for buildings that not only meet today's needs but also leave a positive legacy for future generations.

Collaboration and Innovation: We work closely with various departments and external partners to ensure continuous innovation. Our R&D department plays a crucial role in developing new technologies and solutions that contribute to our vision of autonomous buildings.

At TPEX International, we are determined to play a leading role in the transition to autonomous buildings. Our expertise and dedication to innovation enable us to manage buildings that are not only efficient and sustainable but also future-ready.

As a data analyst, you will manage, analyze, and maintain building data accurately. Your core task is to convey data accurately to the end customer. You ensure that the data is accurate and complete, as our automatic tools will not work accurately otherwise. Besides these tasks, there is time and space to develop yourself and contribute to the R&D department. Here we develop tools to automate aspects of building management. Think of reading buildings and directing suppliers based on this information.
Collecting and processing large datasets from various sources.
Analyzing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Developing reports and dashboards to visualize and communicate findings.
Collaborating with various departments to identify data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Ensuring the integrity and quality of the data.
Advising stakeholders based on data analysis and findings.
Analytical Thinking: Ability to analyze and interpret complex data to obtain valuable insights.
Technical Skills: Experience with data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau & Azure.
Problem-Solving Ability: Able to identify problems and develop effective solutions based on data analysis.
Communication: Strong oral and written communication skills to present findings clearly and concisely to stakeholders.
Detail-Oriented: Accuracy and attention to detail when working with data to ensure the integrity and quality of the data.
Collaboration: Ability to work effectively with various departments and teams to identify data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Vacation Days: 25 vacation days per year.
Company Lunch: A joint lunch every Tuesday.
Team: Working in a small, close-knit team.
Team events: Regular fun team events.
Work Environment: Particularly inspiring environment in the EDGE Stadium in Amsterdam.
Salary indication: €3.800,- tot €4.500,- depending on experience and skill.

4141633234,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-tech-rise-4141633234?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=vvRC1KbYFKLhk3N4GDxK%2BQ%3D%3D&trackingId=3o6VALYI84D0znx6n%2BZYWw%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Tech Rise,"Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands","Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive meaningful insights and business decisions? Do you want to contribute to a company that helps individuals achieve their professional goals? If so, this Data Analyst role could be the perfect fit for you!
Your Role as a Data Analyst

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping data-driven strategies by analyzing complex datasets and delivering actionable insights. Your work will directly impact product development, marketing strategies, and overall business performance. Additionally, you will help optimize internal processes and enhance platform efficiency through data-driven solutions.
Database Optimization: Design and maintain scalable database structures for analytics and insights.
ETL Processes: Develop and manage ETL pipelines to integrate and transform data from multiple sources.
Data Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Looker Studio to support business decision-making.
User Behavior Analysis: Analyze user engagement, cohort behaviors, and platform performance to improve the user experience.
Payment Data Analysis: Work with payment gateway data (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) to monitor subscription trends and revenue performance.
Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, finance, and product, to meet data needs.
Compliance: Ensure data handling aligns with GDPR and other relevant regulations.

You are an analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail, capable of translating raw data into meaningful insights. You enjoy working collaboratively but can also drive independent projects to completion. Adaptable and curious, you’re always eager to enhance your skills and contribute to a data-driven culture.
Strong proficiency in SQL and Python.
Experience with Looker Studio, BigQuery, and other data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Hands-on experience with ETL tools like Apache Airflow, dbt, or Fivetran.
Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or Amplitude.
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.
Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.
A competitive salary based on experience.
25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Looker Studio and BigQuery.

Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive meaningful insights and business decisions? Do you want to contribute to a company that helps individuals achieve their professional goals? If so, this Data Analyst role could be the perfect fit for you!


Your Role as a Data Analyst

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping data-driven strategies by analyzing complex datasets and delivering actionable insights. Your work will directly impact product development, marketing strategies, and overall business performance. Additionally, you will help optimize internal processes and enhance platform efficiency through data-driven solutions.


Key Responsibilities

  • Database Optimization: Design and maintain scalable database structures for analytics and insights.
  • ETL Processes: Develop and manage ETL pipelines to integrate and transform data from multiple sources.
  • Data Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Looker Studio to support business decision-making.
  • User Behavior Analysis: Analyze user engagement, cohort behaviors, and platform performance to improve the user experience.
  • Payment Data Analysis: Work with payment gateway data (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) to monitor subscription trends and revenue performance.
  • Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, finance, and product, to meet data needs.
  • Compliance: Ensure data handling aligns with GDPR and other relevant regulations.


Who You Are

You are an analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail, capable of translating raw data into meaningful insights. You enjoy working collaboratively but can also drive independent projects to completion. Adaptable and curious, you’re always eager to enhance your skills and contribute to a data-driven culture.


Your Skills and Qualifications

Technical Skills:

  • Strong proficiency in SQL and Python.
  • Experience with Looker Studio, BigQuery, and other data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
  • Hands-on experience with ETL tools like Apache Airflow, dbt, or Fivetran.
  • Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or Amplitude.


Education &
column2:
Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
  • 3–5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.

Bonus Skills:

  • Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
  • Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.


What’s Offered

  • A competitive salary based on experience.
  • 25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
  • A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
  • Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
  • A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
  • Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
  • Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Looker Studio and BigQuery.

4169086125,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-at-abbvie-4169086125?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=vvRC1KbYFKLhk3N4GDxK%2BQ%3D%3D&trackingId=fkV8c51ls8K5o9G1W0EDnA%3D%3D,Business Data Analyst,AbbVie,"Hoofddorp, North Holland, Netherlands","Beschrijving van het bedrijf

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Als Business Data Analyst ben je onderdeel van het Customer Excellence Team, waarbij je onze organisatie ondersteunt en faciliteert met data-analyse en effectief besluitvormingsproces mogelijk maakt. In nauwe samenwerking met je collega's in Customer Excellence, Business Technology Services en de verschillende zakelijke belanghebbenden, transformeer je markt- en klantgegevens in duurzame dashboards/analytische rapporten op basis van zakelijke use cases. De ideale kandidaat heeft een sterke affiniteit met data-analyse en de gezondheidszorgomgeving, is een snelle leerling en brengt een positieve 'can-do' mentaliteit mee. Je rapporteert aan de Manager Business Analytics.

Analytics & Reporting - Begrijp, combineer en transformeer lokale en wereldwijde datasets in visualisaties. Bouw duurzame dashboards (PowerBI) om zowel operationele rapportage als strategische besluitvorming te ondersteunen. Begeleid collega's bij het ontwikkelen van de juiste visualisaties voor het presenteren van resultaten.

Data modeling - Begrijp en optimaliseer de datamodellen van huidige use cases. Ontwikkel datamodellen voor nieuwe use cases. Help bij het beheren van de verschillende datamodellen die zakelijke gebruikers in staat stellen hun vragen te beantwoorden.

Data governance - Werk samen met interne belanghebbenden van verschillende afdelingen om vorm te geven aan hoe we klantgegevens beheren, om afstemming te waarborgen en analytische tools duurzaam en compliant te houden.
State-of-the-art data platform - Mogelijkheid om vertrouwd te raken met een state-of-the-art data platform (Palantir Foundry).
Innovatie - Verken en innoveer nieuwe oplossingen en mogelijkheden op het gebied van data, analytics en AI om zakelijke problemen en kansen aan te pakken.
Bachelor's of hoger diploma met academische cursussen in kwantitatieve methoden, analytics, statistiek, economie of financiën.
Ervaring in een zakelijke omgeving en ervaring met relevante klant-/marktgegevens binnen de biofarmaceutische industrie is een pluspunt.

Analytisch sterk. Vermogen om snel analytics en dataproducten te koppelen aan zakelijke behoeften. In staat om gegevens te analyseren en zinvolle conclusies te trekken. Affiniteit met relationele database query-talen zoals SQL.
Je moet snel in de driver's seat kunnen zitten en aan de verschillende use cases kunnen werken met het vermogen om snel de nieuwe omgeving en het Palantir Foundry-platform te leren.

Expertkennis van een analysetool zoals Microsoft PowerBI en nieuwsgierig om meer te leren over hun platforms. Gepassioneerd over technologie en enthousiast over de impact van opkomende/disruptieve technologieën.
Hecht belang aan het creëren van duurzame, goed gedocumenteerde, conforme dataproducten.
Geweldige samenwerker en uitstekende schriftelijke en mondelinge communicatieve vaardigheden.
Vermogen om zelfstandig zakelijke vragen te formuleren, gegevensbronnen te identificeren, een methodologie te formuleren en projecttijden en -resultaten te beheren.
Vloeiend in zowel Engels als bij voorkeur Nederlands, met uitstekende schriftelijke, mondelinge en presentatievaardigheden.

AbbVie zet zich in om integer te handelen, innovatie te bevorderen, levens te veranderen, onze gemeenschap te dienen en diversiteit en inclusie te omarmen. Het is het beleid van AbbVie om gekwalificeerde mensen aan te nemen op basis van vaardigheden, zonder discriminatie ten opzichte van werknemers of sollicitanten op grond van ras, huidskleur, godsdienst, afkomst, leeftijd, geslacht (inclusief zwangerschap), lichamelijke of geestelijke beperking, medische aandoening, genetische informatie, geslachtsidentiteit of -uitdrukking, seksuele geaardheid, burgerlijke staat of elke andere vorm van discriminatie.

Beschrijving van het bedrijf

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Functieomschrijving

Als Business Data Analyst ben je onderdeel van het Customer Excellence Team, waarbij je onze organisatie ondersteunt en faciliteert met data-analyse en effectief besluitvormingsproces mogelijk maakt. In nauwe samenwerking met je collega's in Customer Excellence, Business Technology Services en de verschillende zakelijke belanghebbenden, transformeer je markt- en klantgegevens in duurzame dashboards/analytische rapporten op basis van zakelijke use cases. De ideale kandidaat heeft een sterke affiniteit met data-analyse en de gezondheidszorgomgeving, is een snelle leerling en brengt een positieve 'can-do' mentaliteit mee. Je rapporteert aan de Manager Business Analytics.


Belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden:

  • Analytics &

    • Je moet snel in de driver's seat kunnen zitten en aan de verschillende use cases kunnen werken met het vermogen om snel de nieuwe omgeving en het Palantir Foundry-platform te leren.
    • Expertkennis van een analysetool zoals Microsoft PowerBI en nieuwsgierig om meer te leren over hun platforms. Gepassioneerd over technologie en enthousiast over de impact van opkomende/disruptieve technologieën.
    • Hecht belang aan het creëren van duurzame, goed gedocumenteerde, conforme dataproducten.
    • Geweldige samenwerker en uitstekende schriftelijke en mondelinge communicatieve vaardigheden.
    • Vermogen om zelfstandig zakelijke vragen te formuleren, gegevensbronnen te identificeren, een methodologie te formuleren en projecttijden en -resultaten te beheren.
    • Vloeiend in zowel Engels als bij voorkeur Nederlands, met uitstekende schriftelijke, mondelinge en presentatievaardigheden.

    AbbVie zet zich in om integer te handelen, innovatie te bevorderen, levens te veranderen, onze gemeenschap te dienen en diversiteit en inclusie te omarmen. Het is het beleid van AbbVie om gekwalificeerde mensen aan te nemen op basis van vaardigheden, zonder discriminatie ten opzichte van werknemers of sollicitanten op grond van ras, huidskleur, godsdienst, afkomst, leeftijd, geslacht (inclusief zwangerschap), lichamelijke of geestelijke beperking, medische aandoening, genetische informatie, geslachtsidentiteit of -uitdrukking, seksuele geaardheid, burgerlijke staat of elke andere vorm van discriminatie.

4163589294,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-paula-s-choice-skincare-4163589294?position=10&pageNum=0&refId=vvRC1KbYFKLhk3N4GDxK%2BQ%3D%3D&trackingId=a4RSseIF%2FL%2BHQcozaw%2FqlA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Paula's Choice Skincare,"Amersfoort, Utrecht, Netherlands","We are Paula’s Choice Skincare, a global skincare company founded in the US (Seattle) in 1995. Paula’s Choice is an ambitious fast-growing brand with an inspiring mission: we uncover the truth about skincare and deliver smart, safe products based on scientific research, without gimmicks and misleading claims. Part of Unilever Prestige Brand since 2021 where we are proud to present our core values and continue to grow together with our sister brands.

Our European headquarters are located in the Netherlands (Amersfoort) and local offices in the UK, France (Paris) and Germany (Berlin). We market our skincare via different business models: direct-to-consumer via our own websites (in UK, Germany, France, The Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Sweden, Denmark), via marketplaces (Amazon and Bol.com), via selected retail partners, including Galeries Lafayette, Space NK, Selfridges, De Bijenkorf, Douglas, and via selected e-tailers including Skincity and CultBeauty.

We are a fast-growing scale-up with a young employer base and a high-energy culture. We adopted an agile way of working and thrive on change. Agile lives and breathes in our full organization, this makes us move fast and grow even faster. We are proud to consistently show high double-digit growth. Our main business (75%) is direct to consumer via our e-commerce business making us a fast-paced profitable organization.

Paula’s Choice is committed to diversity! Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for empowering people to achieve their own definition of beautiful, Paula’s Choice could be a wonderful fit for you.
Does this sound inspiring? That’s great! Because we’d love to get to know you. We are looking for a
As a Data Analyst, you will focus on translating our data into actionable insights and building robust data models for our data team.

You will be the data team member who continuously raises the effectiveness of our initiatives by providing data-driven insights and advising on how to improve further. You will constantly work on obtaining an in-depth understanding of the business challenges from your stakeholders and using these insights to develop (data-driven) solutions while always thinking customer-first (internal and external). The data intelligence consists of designing, building and maintaining reporting (PowerBi) as well as analyses to (dis)prove hypotheses or evaluate initiatives from the business.

Furthermore, you will work on designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines and analytics solutions. You will work closely with data teammembers and business stakeholders to understand the requirements and translate these into a data model. You are responsible to ensure that data is accessible, reliable, and actionable.

In this role, you will report directly to the data team manager. You will mainly support all different types of functional domains, but the main focus is on marketing areas such as Retention, Online Marketing and eCommerce. As our data team is consistently evolving, hardly anything is set in stone, and you will be challenged to be innovative and creative in finding innovative solutions.
Work with various stakeholders from several departments to perform data-driven analyses, transform the results into actionable insights, and communicate the results to the stakeholders.
Design and implement scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and store large volumes of data.
Develop and maintain ETL (extract, transform, load) processes to ensure data quality and integrity.
Develop, maintain, and update Power BI dashboards containing customer metrics and KPIs used by various internal stakeholders.
Educating teams on data-informed decision-making and advocating the work of the data team across the business

At least 4+ years of relevant working experience as business/data analyst/analytics engineer or any other relevant data role, preferably in Marketing, retail, e-commerce or other related business function
Experience in building and maintaining data models
Master’s degree, preferably in business, statistics, marketing, IT or a relevant related field
Natural tendency to always want to raise the bar and put the customer first (internal and external)
Thrives on working with a multi-disciplinary group of stakeholders and enjoys presenting insights to business partners
Analytically strong data addict, gets energy from quickly creating insights and translating these into actionable improvement suggestions.
Self-starting and able to balance thoroughness with speed and focus on delivery
Experience with SQL, Python and version control system like GIT. Databricks, PowerBi, Apache Spark, Microsoft Azure are a plus

Do you recognize yourself in the above and do you enjoy working in a dynamic and informal work environment? Then we’d love to get to know you and hopefully welcome you to join our enthusiastic team soon. We look forward to receiving a motivation together with your Curriculum Vitae.

Our culture is the result of our behaviors, our personal commitments, our willingness to collaborate, listen and learn. If you recognize yourself in our values, you will feel at home at Paula’s Choice:
Each of us is powerful on our own, but together we are unstoppable.
BUILD TRUST: We set the standard for skincare, transparency and shared knowledge
BE BOLD: We lead through innovation and disrupting the status quo
ACT WITH KINDNESS: We operate out of respect and care for our customers, our colleagues, and the planet
CREATE COMMUNITY: We build a welcoming and inclusive community with a culture of growth and empowerment

We are Paula’s Choice Skincare, a global skincare company founded in the US (Seattle) in 1995. Paula’s Choice is an ambitious fast-growing brand with an inspiring mission: we uncover the truth about skincare and deliver smart, safe products based on scientific research, without gimmicks and misleading claims. Part of Unilever Prestige Brand since 2021 where we are proud to present our core values and continue to grow together with our sister brands.



Our European headquarters are located in the Netherlands (Amersfoort) and local offices in the UK, France (Paris) and Germany (Berlin). We market our skincare via different business models: direct-to-consumer via our own websites (in UK, Germany, France, The Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Sweden, Denmark), via marketplaces (Amazon and Bol.com), via selected retail partners, including Galeries Lafayette, Space NK, Selfridges, De Bijenkorf, Douglas, and via selected e-tailers including Skincity and CultBeauty.



We are a fast-growing scale-up with a young employer base and a high-energy culture. We adopted an agile way of working and thrive on change. Agile lives and breathes in our full organization, this makes us move fast and grow even faster. We are proud to consistently show high double-digit growth. Our main business (75%) is direct to consumer via our e-commerce business making us a fast-paced profitable organization.



Paula’s Choice is committed to diversity! Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for empowering people to achieve their own definition of beautiful, Paula’s Choice could be a wonderful fit for you.



Does this sound inspiring? That’s great! Because we’d love to get to know you. We are looking for a




Data Analyst

Full Time | Amersfoort


As a Data Analyst, you will focus on translating our data into actionable insights and building robust data models for our data team.


You will be the data team member who continuously raises the effectiveness of our initiatives by providing data-driven insights and advising on how to improve further. You will constantly work on obtaining an in-depth understanding of the business challenges from your stakeholders and using these insights to develop (data-driven) solutions while always thinking customer-first (internal and external). The data intelligence consists of designing, building and maintaining reporting (PowerBi) as well as analyses to (dis)prove hypotheses or evaluate initiatives from the business.


Furthermore, you will work on designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines and analytics solutions. You will work closely with data teammembers and business stakeholders to understand the requirements and translate these into a data model. You are responsible to ensure that data is accessible, reliable, and actionable.


In this role, you will report directly to the data team manager. You will mainly support all different types of functional domains, but the main focus is on marketing areas such as Retention, Online Marketing and eCommerce. As our data team is consistently evolving, hardly anything is set in stone, and you will be challenged to be innovative and creative in finding innovative solutions.


What will you be doing:

  • Work with various stakeholders from several departments to perform data-driven analyses, transform the results into actionable insights, and communicate the results to the stakeholders.
  • Design and implement scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and store large volumes of data.
  • Develop and maintain ETL (extract, transform, load) processes to ensure data quality and integrity.
  • Develop, maintain, and update Power BI dashboards containing customer metrics and KPIs used by various internal stakeholders.
  • Educating teams on data-informed decision-making and advocating the work of the data team across the business


What will you bring?

  • At least 4+ years of relevant working experience as business/data analyst/analytics engineer or any other relevant data role, preferably in Marketing, retail, e-commerce or other related business function
  • Experience in building and maintaining data models
  • Master’s degree, preferably in business, statistics, marketing, IT or a relevant related field
  • Natural tendency to always want to raise the bar and put the customer first (internal and external)
  • Thrives on working with a multi-disciplinary group of stakeholders and enjoys presenting insights to business partners
  • Analytically strong data addict, gets energy from quickly creating insights and translating these into actionable improvement suggestions.
  • Self-starting and able to balance thoroughness with speed and focus on delivery
  • Experience with SQL, Python and version control system like GIT. Databricks, PowerBi, Apache Spark, Microsoft Azure are a plus
  • Fluent in English



Do you recognize yourself in the above and do you enjoy working in a dynamic and informal work environment? Then we’d love to get to know you and hopefully welcome you to join our enthusiastic team soon. We look forward to receiving a motivation together with your Curriculum Vitae.



Our culture is the result of our behaviors, our personal commitments, our willingness to collaborate, listen and learn. If you recognize yourself in our values, you will feel at home at Paula’s Choice:



Each of us is powerful on our own, but together we are unstoppable.


BUILD TRUST: We set the standard for skincare, transparency and shared knowledge

BE BOLD: We lead through innovation and disrupting the status quo

ACT WITH KINDNESS: We operate out of respect and care for our customers, our colleagues, and the planet

CREATE COMMUNITY: We build a welcoming and inclusive community with a culture of growth and empowerment

4165000159,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analist-powerbi-at-experis-4165000159?position=11&pageNum=0&refId=vvRC1KbYFKLhk3N4GDxK%2BQ%3D%3D&trackingId=X0s2lTHIhigaoonGPJkR9g%3D%3D,Data Analist | PowerBI,Experis,"Utrecht, Netherlands","Ben jij een Data Analist en heb je veel verstand van Data en PowerBI? Wil jij je inzetten voor de Nederlandse vluchtelingensector? Vind jij het leuk om met veel verschillende stakeholders te schakelen en te werken aan een BI Competence Centre? Lees dan snel verder!
Jouw taken als Data Analist bestaan uit:
Het zorgdragen voor de juiste implementatie van het BICC
Het in kaart brengen van wensen uit de business
Het meedenken over datamogelijkheden en waar nodig deze vertalen naar beleid en/of actiepunten
Actief meedenken over verbetermogelijkheden over de data-omgeving.

Deze organisatie in Utrecht, waar jij als Data Analist komt te werken, vormt een onmisbaar onderdeel in de Nederlandse vluchtelingenopvang. Dag in dag uit werken de beste (zorg)professionals samen om vluchtelingen hulp te bieden.

De organisatie is momenteel druk bezig om een Business Intelligence Competence Center (BICC) op te zetten om als interne hub op het gebied van BI te acteren. Dit maakt het voor hen mogelijk om grote hoeveelheden data en processen op de juiste manier te centraliseren en daar de business optimaal te ondersteunen. Hier werken momenteel twee collega's, een kwartiermaker en een externe leverancier aan, maar kunnen hier nog extra ondersteuning in gebruiken.

Als BI Specialist zorg jij dat het BICC op de juiste wijze wordt opgeleverd. Je zorgt voor goede interne en externe communicatie rondom de data-ontwikkelingen. Jij vormt de brug tussen de business en het platform, waardoor je schakelt met stakeholders om wensen in kaart te brengen en deze te vertalen naar concrete BI-oplossingen. Daarnaast denk je actief mee hoe je met behulp van de beschikbare data de business optimaal kan ondersteunen. Samen met de IT Manager en Informatiemanager werk je aan het databeleid voor de komende jaren. Gezien dit een relatief nieuwe rol is, is er veel ruimte voor eigen initiatief en verantwoordelijkheid.
Je vervult een brugfunctie tussen IT en de organisatie en weet precies hoe je met data je doel kan bereiken, hopelijk ook gepaard met een gezonde dosis humor!

Dit doe je uiteraard niet alleen. Je werkt samen in het IT-team dat dagelijks verantwoordelijk is voor de strategie en operatie op IT-vlak en daarnaast kun je altijd terugvallen op je collega's binnen het BI domein.
Ben je enthousiast geworden over deze leuke uitdaging of wil je toch nog wat meer weten? Neem dan gerust telefonisch contact op óf stuur mij een berichtje via Whatsapp.
Als Data Analist neem je tenminste mee:
Een achtergrond in Data Analyse of BI Development
Ervaring met het in kaart brengen en verbeteren van processen is een pre
Affiniteit met de zorg, overheid of de vluchtelingensector
Communicatief vaardig met een pro-actieve houding
Ervaring met stakeholdermanagement tot aan directieniveau.
De arbeidsvoorwaarden voor deze functie bestaan onder andere uit:

4157009785,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-kubota-holdings-europe-4157009785?position=12&pageNum=0&refId=vvRC1KbYFKLhk3N4GDxK%2BQ%3D%3D&trackingId=CzJ4k2cbk4BTVWx2Pr%2FC6w%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,Kubota Holdings Europe,"Nieuw-Vennep, North Holland, Netherlands","Lay the groundwork for tomorrow with Kubota!

Since 1890, Kubota has evolved in a unique way worldwide. With a strong will to solve problems in food, water and the environment, we have leveraged our strength as a manufacturer and a solutions provider. Spanning across 120+ countries and employing more than 50,000 people in Asia, Europe and North America, Kubota generates revenue in excess of $20 billion. From agricultural and industrial machinery, and overall water solutions, to any other living environment solution, our question, and our challenge was always the same: what can we do to meet the demands and enhance our lives for tomorrow?
Explore this exciting career opportunity and join us on the journey as we seek to be an “Essentials Innovator for Supporting Life”.

Are you intraprenuer? Do you want to contribute to an economically and sustainably future-proof farmer’s wellbeing relevant to the Europe? Are you looking for hands-on opportunities to develop products that will be on the market within next 3 years? If so, we have an interesting position for you at Kubota's Innovation Center Europe (ICE).

In June 2019, Kubota Corporation established Innovation Centers, first in Japan and then Europe, for the creation of new business ventures, products and services in Kubota’s fields of business, including agriculture and construction. Working together with external partners, the Innovation Centers should foster open innovation for proactive engagement with ICT, AI, Telematics and other advanced technologies, to accelerate the creation of new business, products and services.

ICE is looking for a business intelligence analyst to provide European support to our innovation team in business model innovation, to deliver analytics to support strategic and operational initiatives of Kubota Innovation Center and to continue to strengthen the quality of our work, grow our portfolio of projects and establish new strategic learning partnerships.

You will conduct independent & joint, high-quality business research, supervised by Strategic Business Development Manager, and incorporate the research findings in innovative product development strategy within agriculture sector. Also, you will be involved in customer development activities within innovation projects with farmers, start-ups, technology providers and business units of Kubota. Main target will be the development on sustainable business models and go-to-market strategies for future products though market intelligence and Power BI tools.
As part of Kubota Innovation Center team, you will have a strong voice in project execution, innovation strategy, process improvements, and structuring joint product development within our portfolio.

Additionally, you continuously strengthen the quality of our work, by identifying systemic fixes and ways to improve our market research and business hypothesis, by ensuring Kubota Innovation Center is always at the cutting edge. You will put the right approach in place to our work and proof that it is useful within the context of the targeted countries and the agriculture & technology entrepreneurship sectors we work in.
In this role, you will interpret & analyze performance indicators and metrics in order to create meaningful dashboards & reporting both at a detailed and executive level:
Designing and developing interactive dashboards and reports
Collaborating with stakeholders to understand data needs
Analyzing datasets to uncover trends and insights
Maintaining data accuracy and integrity within BI systems
Translating business requirements into technical specifications
Master degree in business administration, economics, development economics, statistics, computer science, or related field with a strong component of financial analysis
Excellent knowledge of MS Excel functionality & ability to work with statistical data for market intelligence surveys
At least 1-2 years of work experience in consulting firm or similar type companies
Demonstrated experience in writing and editing market analysis
Communicate easy about complex topics: data visualization skills
Proactive business affinity and min. B2 proficiency in English
What we would like to see in you:
Proficiency in other European languages (e.g., French, Italian, Spanish).
Keenness to synthesise evidence from diverse sources (qualitative interviews, design surveys, statistical data, etc.)
Good understanding of deliverables, including statistical information from open sources and literature reviews, and ability to convey complex information concisely and clearly
Interest to develop, or previous experience, in analysing big data
What you can expect from us:
Rapidly growing international team with focus on result and disruptive ideas in agriculture sector
Ongoing training and development opportunities which foster and shape your individual career path
The opportunity to thrive in a global, collaborative environment while working every day to improve farmer well-being & profitability.
Diverse, inclusive culture that encourages you to bring your whole self to work

4157199738,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-intern-at-royaltyport-4157199738?position=16&pageNum=0&refId=vvRC1KbYFKLhk3N4GDxK%2BQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ZiAZeGJeJvrbwKucd%2FFxyg%3D%3D,Data Analyst Intern,Royaltyport,"Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands","About Royaltyport:

Royaltyport assists artists and their managers in managing their music business intelligently. Our mission is to ensure artists understand their rights and income, receiving fair compensation. Founded by seasoned entrepreneurs with extensive music industry expertise, Royaltyport has recently launched its product and is already collaborating with artists like Sam Feldt, Purple Disco Machine, Oliver Heldens, and John Newman.
We’re looking for a passionate data analyst intern to join our team. You’ll collaborate closely with seasoned startup founders, experienced engineers, and our expert data lead.

Musicians receive revenue reports in various formats and from multiple sources. Your role will involve identifying errors in the data and visualising it in a way that is clear and actionable for our artists. This could involve areas of underpayment, errors in royalty calculations, or missing payments altogether. You will focus on both novel and common reporting errors in the industry. Additionally, you will become an expert on different types of royalties and develop expertise in musical earnings over the course of your internship.

We’re seeking someone who learns quickly and is eager to dive in and make a meaningful impact. If you’re not afraid to roll up your sleeves and want to play a role in a changing industry, we’d love to hear from you.
Students pursuing an academic university degree or recent graduates in econometrics, data science, statistics, or computer/information sciences.
Eligibility to work in the Netherlands.
Experience with Looker Studio or visualisation platforms like PowerBi or Tableau.
Any kind of pre existing knowledge on music royalties.
Thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Is available at least 3 days a week, and can frequently come to our office in Amsterdam.
Is available for at least 4 months.
Passion for music and the music industry is a plus, though not required.
Proficiency in Dutch is a plus, though not required.
An opportunity to work in the music industry and gain a unique peek behind the curtain.
Learn for experienced data professionals and startup founders.

If you’re excited about this opportunity, send your information to hello@royaltyport.com. Sharing previous work, if applicable, is highly encouraged. The first step is an initial online meeting. We might ask you to do a technical test, depending on your level of experience.

About Royaltyport:

Royaltyport assists artists and their managers in managing their music business intelligently. Our mission is to ensure artists understand their rights and income, receiving fair compensation. Founded by seasoned entrepreneurs with extensive music industry expertise, Royaltyport has recently launched its product and is already collaborating with artists like Sam Feldt, Purple Disco Machine, Oliver Heldens, and John Newman.


About You:

We’re looking for a passionate data analyst intern to join our team. You’ll collaborate closely with seasoned startup founders, experienced engineers, and our expert data lead.


Musicians receive revenue reports in various formats and from multiple sources. Your role will involve identifying errors in the data and visualising it in a way that is clear and actionable for our artists. This could involve areas of underpayment, errors in royalty calculations, or missing payments altogether. You will focus on both novel and common reporting errors in the industry. Additionally, you will become an expert on different types of royalties and develop expertise in musical earnings over the course of your internship.


We’re seeking someone who learns quickly and is eager to dive in and make a meaningful impact. If you’re not afraid to roll up your sleeves and want to play a role in a changing industry, we’d love to hear from you.


Requirements:

  • Must-Have:
  • Students pursuing an academic university degree or recent graduates in econometrics, data science, statistics, or computer/information sciences.
  • Strong knowledge of SQL.
  • Strong analytical capabilities.
  • Eligibility to work in the Netherlands.
  • Bonus Points For:
  • Experience with Looker Studio or visualisation platforms like PowerBi or Tableau.
  • Experience in Python.
  • Any analytical work experience.
  • Any kind of pre existing knowledge on music royalties.


Our Ideal Candidate:

  • Believes in our mission.
  • Able to work independently.
  • Thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • Is available at least 3 days a week, and can frequently come to our office in Amsterdam.
  • Is available for at least 4 months.
  • Passion for music and the music industry is a plus, though not required.
  • Proficiency in Dutch is a plus, though not required.


What We Offer:

  • An opportunity to work in the music industry and gain a unique peek behind the curtain.
  • An internship allowance of €500,-.
  • Learn for experienced data professionals and startup founders.


What’s next:

If you’re excited about this opportunity, send your information to hello@royaltyport.com. Sharing previous work, if applicable, is highly encouraged. The first step is an initial online meeting. We might ask you to do a technical test, depending on your level of experience.

4164095904,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/managerial-reporting-specialist-at-van-caem-klerks-group-4164095904?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=vvRC1KbYFKLhk3N4GDxK%2BQ%3D%3D&trackingId=fVuWcm%2BvQGJ2I43DEgeWBw%3D%3D,Managerial Reporting Specialist,Van Caem Klerks Group,"Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands","About the job

Van Caem Klerks Group is an international trading company operating within global markets. Van Caem Klerks Group buys and sells A-branded goods in a variety of different categories, namely: Liquor, Fragrance & Cosmetics and FMCG and We are a service-oriented company with over 50 years of experience in the import/export industry. Our head office is in the heart of Amsterdam, with our international offices in Malta and Curacao. We have 2 of our own warehouses strategically placed near the Port of Rotterdam which helps us provide the best and most efficient service.

Van Caem Klerks Group has a turnover of over 300 million and yet despite this we are quite an informal, flat-organizational structure that prioritizes employee growth and progression. We pride ourselves on our international focus, with over 30 nationalities represented within the company of over 150 employees.

Van Caem Klerks Group consists of the following departments: Trade, Trade Support, Legal, Finance, Treasury, ICT, HR and the Warehouses. We are working towards being a data-driven company and therefore are investing in various software and expansion of the teams: CRM, Cloud, Business Development, Business Intelligence and E-Commerce. We strive for professional growth amongst all employees due to our collaborative and cooperative environment and we also offer a variety of other perks, such as a daily in-house chef service, a company boat – perfect for cruising through Amsterdam’s canals - free drinks at the company bar, a pension plan and of course 25 paid holiday days. Bonuses are calculated based on performance throughout the year due to the fair bonus scheme.

As a data- and KPI-driven company, Van Caem Klerks Group is looking for a Managerial Reporting Specialist, who will be responsible for providing Management of the company with regular and ad hoc business performance reports from all areas of the organization: Commercial, Finance, Operations, HR and so on. This person will have a full complete overview of the company’s performance and will play a crucial role in generating conclusive and actionable insights and recommendations. If you are passionate about making an impact via data analysis and presentation and want to see your actions producing real business improvements – this role is for you!
Background in Technical Sciences, Business, Economics, Accounting.
No previous work experience required, but previous Big4 or consultancy experience will be a strong plus.
Experience in MS Excel and MS Power Point. You don’t need to know everything but will have to be able to learn new things and fast.
Critical thinking, ability to see big picture while being attentive to details.
Strong communication skills and ability to patiently explain complex matters in simple terms.
Self-organization and time management skills to fulfil daily, weekly, monthly reporting requirements.
Ability to manage stress level when working against a deadline.
Ability to switch efficiently between tasks of different nature
Positive and self-driven personality will make you very successful in this role and in our Company as a whole!
Ability to kick-start a career w/o previous work experience
Very dynamic company operating on global scale
International and energetic team of 30+ nationalities
Working very closely with Senior Management of the organization
Salary level will be discussed with successful candidates
Performance based annual bonus up to 3 monthly salaries
PLEASE NOTE: 5 days in the office, WFH/Hybrid is not possible
PLEASE NOTE: Candidates from Europe only
In-person interview in the office: 60 mins
Trial day at the office: 2-3 hours

About the job


Van Caem Klerks Group is an international trading company operating within global markets. Van Caem Klerks Group buys and sells A-branded goods in a variety of different categories, namely: Liquor, Fragrance &
column2:
Cosmetics and FMCG and We are a service-oriented company with over 50 years of experience in the import/export industry. Our head office is in the heart of Amsterdam, with our international offices in Malta and Curacao. We have 2 of our own warehouses strategically placed near the Port of Rotterdam which helps us provide the best and most efficient service.


Van Caem Klerks Group has a turnover of over 300 million and yet despite this we are quite an informal, flat-organizational structure that prioritizes employee growth and progression. We pride ourselves on our international focus, with over 30 nationalities represented within the company of over 150 employees.


Van Caem Klerks Group consists of the following departments: Trade, Trade Support, Legal, Finance, Treasury, ICT, HR and the Warehouses. We are working towards being a data-driven company and therefore are investing in various software and expansion of the teams: CRM, Cloud, Business Development, Business Intelligence and E-Commerce. We strive for professional growth amongst all employees due to our collaborative and cooperative environment and we also offer a variety of other perks, such as a daily in-house chef service, a company boat – perfect for cruising through Amsterdam’s canals - free drinks at the company bar, a pension plan and of course 25 paid holiday days. Bonuses are calculated based on performance throughout the year due to the fair bonus scheme.


We are looking for:


As a data- and KPI-driven company, Van Caem Klerks Group is looking for a Managerial Reporting Specialist, who will be responsible for providing Management of the company with regular and ad hoc business performance reports from all areas of the organization: Commercial, Finance, Operations, HR and so on. This person will have a full complete overview of the company’s performance and will play a crucial role in generating conclusive and actionable insights and recommendations. If you are passionate about making an impact via data analysis and presentation and want to see your actions producing real business improvements – this role is for you!


Requirements

  • Fluent in English.
  • Background in Technical Sciences, Business, Economics, Accounting.
  • No previous work experience required, but previous Big4 or consultancy experience will be a strong plus.
  • Experience in MS Excel and MS Power Point. You don’t need to know everything but will have to be able to learn new things and fast.
  • Critical thinking, ability to see big picture while being attentive to details.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to patiently explain complex matters in simple terms.
  • Self-organization and time management skills to fulfil daily, weekly, monthly reporting requirements.
  • Ability to manage stress level when working against a deadline.
  • Ability to switch efficiently between tasks of different nature
  • Positive and self-driven personality will make you very successful in this role and in our Company as a whole!


Benefits

  • Ability to kick-start a career w/o previous work experience
  • Very dynamic company operating on global scale
  • International and energetic team of 30+ nationalities
  • Working very closely with Senior Management of the organization
  • Salary level will be discussed with successful candidates
  • 8% holiday allowance
  • Pension scheme
  • 25 vacation days
  • Performance based annual bonus up to 3 monthly salaries
  • PLEASE NOTE: 5 days in the office, WFH/Hybrid is not possible
  • PLEASE NOTE: Candidates from Europe only


Recruitment process

  • Introductory interview by Teams: 30 mins
  • In-person interview in the office: 60 mins
  • Trial day at the office: 2-3 hours
  • Job offer to successful candidates

column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 9l5.93-4L15 6.54l-6.15 4.2a1.5 1.5 0 01-1.69 0L1 6.54 2.07 5z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

4025199263,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-%E2%80%93-advertising-at-bol-4025199263?position=21&pageNum=0&refId=vvRC1KbYFKLhk3N4GDxK%2BQ%3D%3D&trackingId=2GGGrla4nXGrMyc5n47w1w%3D%3D,Data Analyst – Advertising,bol,"Utrecht, Utrecht, Netherlands","How do you delight our customers?

Bol is always advancing its platform to create a better tomorrow for over 13 million customers and 49,000 trading partners. Our advertising propositions help shoppers discover products and advertisers reach customers – this is where you’ll make a difference. You’ll use data to help our advertising customers inform decisions, frame conversations, and change perceptions. And you’ll ensure it’s used effectively and responsibly.

Advertising via Bol is growing fast and is becoming an increasingly important channel for our advertising customers. Their need for data and insights are no exception. They rely on us to provide them with meaningful metrics, insightful analyses, and reliable predictive models to keep investing effectively
What You’ll Do As a Data Analyst

You’ll join 15 analysts in Bol’s advertising analytics organization. Together you share a mission of making people performant through analytics. This role is for the versatile analyst who is equally comfortable working with data as engaging with stakeholders. You’ll work with stakeholders to identify high value use cases for analytics, use SQL, Python, Dbt, and Tableau to then create metrics, do analysis across petabytes of data, make meaningful predictions, to eventually help advertising customers make better decisions. Your work will be input for amongst others client meetings, white papers, webinars, and public industry appearances.
You work closely with internal stakeholders (Sales, Customer Success, and Marketing) and top advertising and agency customers to identify high value applications of analytics.
You’re curious and develop deep domain knowledge to create meaningful language around our data and insights for our customers.
You prioritize, design, and perform analysis and/or dashboards.
You deliver insights and predictions through engaging dashboards and presentations.
You develop extensive domain knowledge to effectively manage and analyse advertising KPIs.
You write high quality and easily interpretable SQL and Python code that can be reused by colleagues and scales easily as data volumes increase.
3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out
If you strongly value clarity No, if innovating, autonomy, and ambiguity sound terrifying to you.
You only want to process data No, if you only want to process data and prefer someone else to handle project and stakeholder management.

If you believe analysts don’t need domain knowledge No, if you don't want to dive into the world of advertising. Curiosity and willingness to learn about our domain and customers are key to your success.
You’re an analytics professional Yes, if you have 5+ year experience delighting decision makers with your analytical skills. SQL is a must, Python scripting is a strong plus.
Obsess over building the right things Yes, if you believe output does not equal outcome and judge success by value creation.
You get (and create) energy by working with others Yes, if you can translate technical information into language anyone can understand. You enjoy working with both data and people.
It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

How do you delight our customers?

Bol is always advancing its platform to create a better tomorrow for over 13 million customers and 49,000 trading partners. Our advertising propositions help shoppers discover products and advertisers reach customers – this is where you’ll make a difference. You’ll use data to help our advertising customers inform decisions, frame conversations, and change perceptions. And you’ll ensure it’s used effectively and responsibly.

The biggest challenge

Advertising via Bol is growing fast and is becoming an increasingly important channel for our advertising customers. Their need for data and insights are no exception. They rely on us to provide them with meaningful metrics, insightful analyses, and reliable predictive models to keep investing effectively

What You’ll Do As a Data Analyst

You’ll join 15 analysts in Bol’s advertising analytics organization. Together you share a mission of making people performant through analytics. This role is for the versatile analyst who is equally comfortable working with data as engaging with stakeholders. You’ll work with stakeholders to identify high value use cases for analytics, use SQL, Python, Dbt, and Tableau to then create metrics, do analysis across petabytes of data, make meaningful predictions, to eventually help advertising customers make better decisions. Your work will be input for amongst others client meetings, white papers, webinars, and public industry appearances.

  • You work closely with internal stakeholders (Sales, Customer Success, and Marketing) and top advertising and agency customers to identify high value applications of analytics.
  • You’re curious and develop deep domain knowledge to create meaningful language around our data and insights for our customers.
  • You prioritize, design, and perform analysis and/or dashboards.
  • You deliver insights and predictions through engaging dashboards and presentations.
  • You develop extensive domain knowledge to effectively manage and analyse advertising KPIs.
  • You write high quality and easily interpretable SQL and Python code that can be reused by colleagues and scales easily as data volumes increase.

3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out

  • If you strongly value clarity No, if innovating, autonomy, and ambiguity sound terrifying to you.
  • You only want to process data No, if you only want to process data and prefer someone else to handle project and stakeholder management.
  • If you believe analysts don’t need domain knowledge No, if you don't want to dive into the world of advertising. Curiosity and willingness to learn about our domain and customers are key to your success.
  • You’re an analytics professional Yes, if you have 5+ year experience delighting decision makers with your analytical skills. SQL is a must, Python scripting is a strong plus.
  • Obsess over building the right things Yes, if you believe output does not equal outcome and judge success by value creation.
  • You get (and create) energy by working with others Yes, if you can translate technical information into language anyone can understand. You enjoy working with both data and people.

It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

4160336597,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analytics-consultant-at-sia-4160336597?position=22&pageNum=0&refId=vvRC1KbYFKLhk3N4GDxK%2BQ%3D%3D&trackingId=QZgYjlsoixY%2BxwwedF2w6Q%3D%3D,Data & Analytics Consultant,Sia,"Rotterdam, South Holland, Netherlands","Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.
Who will you be working with?

The Amsterdam Data Science team is young, diverse and growing. You will work in a team that challenges you and invests in your professional development. We have a flat structure and rely on the entrepreneurial spirit of our colleagues. Taking the initiative is strongly encouraged. We strive for well-being, diversity and knowledge sharing within the team, so that we can grow together.
What you are going to do

As a Data & Analytics Consultant, you will work with our Data Scientists, Data Engineers and other consultants at Sia, on various client projects in multidisciplinary teams. You will use your analytical mindset and data skills to solve complex business problems and deliver actionable insights.
Work closely with Sia consultants on assignments with an analytical challenge
Identify business problems by extracting, interpreting and explaining insights from data
Develop statistical and analytical methods to solve specific operational problems
Ensure that the deep insights generated from advanced analytics translate into business impact
Present results and conduct workshops at customer sites
You want to make business impact, not only by doing data analysis, but also by making recommendations through inspiring presentations
You have the ability to adapt quickly and work across different business areas within a challenging environment
You have exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills
You have the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
You have excellent communication skills and can present complex concepts in a synthetic way
You have a good track record of leadership in an academic, professional or extracurricular setting.
Completed WO Master's degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Business Analytics or a related field of study.
You are a young graduate or already have several years of experience in a similar position.
Good skills in Python and at least one other analytical language (e.g. R, SQL)
Experience with data visualization and reporting (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)
Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques or optimization is a strong plus
Fluent in English and Dutch, both written and oral. Additional languages are a strong plus.
Training opportunities to develop yourself further
Opportunities to work on international assignments
An attractive package (e.g. lease car, health insurance, pension scheme)
We are unable to provide a work permit for this position
Non-Dutch speaker will unfortunately not be accepted
Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.





Job Description

Who will you be working with?
The Amsterdam Data Science team is young, diverse and growing. You will work in a team that challenges you and invests in your professional development. We have a flat structure and rely on the entrepreneurial spirit of our colleagues. Taking the initiative is strongly encouraged. We strive for well-being, diversity and knowledge sharing within the team, so that we can grow together.

What you are going to do
As a Data &
column2:
Analytics Consultant, you will work with our Data Scientists, Data Engineers and other consultants at Sia, on various client projects in multidisciplinary teams. You will use your analytical mindset and data skills to solve complex business problems and deliver actionable insights.

Responsibilities include:

  • Work closely with Sia consultants on assignments with an analytical challenge
  • Identify business problems by extracting, interpreting and explaining insights from data
  • Develop statistical and analytical methods to solve specific operational problems
  • Ensure that the deep insights generated from advanced analytics translate into business impact
  • Present results and conduct workshops at customer sites

Who you are

  • You want to make business impact, not only by doing data analysis, but also by making recommendations through inspiring presentations
  • You have the ability to adapt quickly and work across different business areas within a challenging environment
  • You have exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills
  • You have the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
  • You have excellent communication skills and can present complex concepts in a synthetic way
  • You have a good track record of leadership in an academic, professional or extracurricular setting.

Qualifications

What you need

  • Completed WO Master's degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Business Analytics or a related field of study.
  • You are a young graduate or already have several years of experience in a similar position.
  • Good skills in Python and at least one other analytical language (e.g. R, SQL)
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)
  • Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques or optimization is a strong plus
  • Fluent in English and Dutch, both written and oral. Additional languages are a strong plus.

What we offer

  • Training opportunities to develop yourself further
  • Opportunities to work on international assignments
  • Flexible working hours
  • A meritocratic approach to promotion
  • Performance related bonus
  • An attractive package (e.g. lease car, health insurance, pension scheme)

Additional Information

We are unable to provide a work permit for this position

Non-Dutch speaker will unfortunately not be accepted

Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

4163412411,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analytics-traineeship-den-haag-at-people-x-4163412411?position=26&pageNum=0&refId=vvRC1KbYFKLhk3N4GDxK%2BQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ciTcIT32HrOXH%2B5MOn63VA%3D%3D,Data Analytics Traineeship Den Haag,People X,"The Hague, South Holland, Netherlands","For Dutch-speaking candidates only (C1 level in Dutch required)

Business Intelligence (BI) is het gehele proces rondom het verzamelen en structureren van data binnen een organisatie teneinde deze data om te zetten in bruikbare beslissingsondersteunende informatie (intelligence). Deze informatie kan vervolgens worden gevisualiseerd in een rapportage of dashboard met rapportagetools waardoor er beslissingen kunnen worden genomen op basis van feiten en cijfers.
Wij starten ieder kwartaal een Data Analytics Traineeship waarin jij door specialisten met ervaring uit de praktijk opgeleid wordt tot een Data Analist, Data Engineer of Data Consultant.

De eerste drie maanden word je fulltime opgeleid (theorie, examens en praktijk) door professionals uit het data vakgebied. Na de opleidingsperiode begeleiden wij je richting een passende opdrachtgever in de regio van jouw woonplaats. Hiervoor ga je in gesprek met opdrachtgevers waarvoor wij je uiteraard goed voorbereiden. Je kiest uiteindelijk zelf waar je wil gaan starten. Denk hierbij aan MKB bedrijven, gemeentelijke-, zorg- en onderwijs organisaties of top 500 bedrijven als Rabobank, TNO, VDL, Alliander, ONVZ, ASR, NOC*NSF, Van Lanschot, Achmea of Gazelle. Na ruim één jaar via People X te hebben gewerkt, treed je in dienst bij de opdrachtgever en maak je weer een stap in salaris.
Je werkzaamheden zijn uiteenlopend en inhoudelijk verschillend per opdrachtgever en branche waar je gaat werken, maar denk hierbij aan:
Het verzamelen, optimaliseren en inzichtelijk maken van bedrijfskundige data- en informatiestromen
Het in kaart brengen van de huidige en de gewenste situatie
Diverse KPI’s (prestatie indicatoren) opstellen, identificeren en visualiseren in BI rapportages of dashboards
Het opzetten en inrichten van een datawarehouse
Het schrijven van Business Rules in SQL
Op basis van je bevindingen advies geven over de huidige en toekomstige bedrijfsvoering
Helpen de organisatie bewuster te worden op het sturen op informatie (data driven).

Je zal hierbij gebruik maken van diverse Business Intelligence tools welke je in het traineeship geleerd krijgt. Communicatief vaardig zijn is belangrijk aangezien jij de juiste informatie en stromingen binnen een organisatie inzichtelijk moet maken door het stellen van de juiste vragen. Bedrijfskundig inzicht is dan ook van toegevoegde waarde.
Wat heeft People X jou te bieden?
Je wordt betaald vanaf dag 1 van het traineeship en ontvangt vanaf je inzet bij een opdrachtgever tussen de € 2750,- en € 3250,- bruto per maand o.b.v. 40 uur
Een specialistisch data traineeship gedoceerd door erkende gecertificeerde trainers
Het behalen van diverse erkende certificeringen die aansluiten op de behoefte in de markt: SQL, Power BI, Azure, Fabric en Scrum / Agile
Het behalen van drie officiële Microsoft Certified titels: Azure Fundamentals, Data Analyst Associate en Fabric Data Engineer Associate
Soft-, Business- en Vitaliteitstrainingen zodat je vanaf het begin stevig in je schoenen staat
Begeleiding en coaching vanuit een persoonlijke Talent Manager die zorgt voor een goede instroom en ontwikkeling bij de opdrachtgever waar je gaat starten
Een gedegen inwerktraject door een ervaren Data specialist en een groot kennisnetwerk van (oud) trainees, trainers en specialisten waar jij op terug kunt vallen en mee kan sparren
Baangarantie bij een toporganisatie in een branche die bij je past en uiteraard in de regio van je woonplaats
Tijdens en na het traineeship ontvang je een kilometervergoeding (€ 0,23) of een NS Businesscard

Een afgeronde wo bèta of bedrijfskundige opleiding of één van de volgende afgeronde bachelor / hbo studies: Informatica, ICT, Business IT & Management, Toegepaste Wiskunde of een vergelijkbare studie aangevuld met datakennis/toolkennis door zelfstudie
Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring, affiniteit en/of het enthousiasme richting Business Intelligence, data en/of databases
Praktische ervaring vanuit stage of studie met data gerelateerde programma’s als SPSS, Matlab, Python, R, Stata, VBA, SQL of vergelijkbaar
Je bent leergierig, analytisch, enthousiast, oplossingsgericht, zelfstandig en hebt de drive om je kennis up-to-date te houden
Je beschikt over goede communicatieve vaardigheden en beheerst naast de Nederlandse taal ook de Engelse taal

Je bent fulltime beschikbaar vanaf de start van het traineeship. Komt dit traineeship te vroeg? Je kunt via deze vacature ook alvast solliciteren voor een van de volgende traineeships. Op de website zie je alle actuele startdata. Geef bij je sollicitatie even aan voor welk traineeship je solliciteert.
