1659205114,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analist-at-incentro-1659205114?position=7&pageNum=5&refId=cO9ntLjWfa4M93hkvF9JeQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ISD6oLilAqd0Q0i16EyMbw%3D%3D,Data analist,Incentro,"The Randstad, Netherlands","Als Data analist bij Incentro speel je een sleutelrol binnen onze Data Solutions-cel, bestaande uit 40+ data experts. Samen helpen we klanten zoals PostNL, Bol, Simon Loos en Veiligheidsregio’s met hun data-uitdagingen.

Je bent de schakel tussen business & IT en zet je analytische skills in om waardevolle inzichten en visuele dashboards te creëren. Je werkt met on-premise en cloud data warehouses en BI-tools binnen AWS, GCP en Azure om data te verzamelen, verwerken en visualiseren.
🔹 Gegevens verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren om trends en patronen te ontdekken.
🔹 SQL gebruiken om databronnen voor te bereiden en datamodellen en dashboards te ontwikkelen.
🔹 Klanten adviseren over data-gedreven strategieën en optimalisaties met data-analyses en visualisaties.
🔹 Ondersteunen bij het embedden van dashboards en de eerste stappen richting self-service BI.

Je werkt samen met een multidisciplinair team van engineers, architecten en analisten. Samen modelleer je logische datamodellen op basis van gegevens uit lokale databases en cloud-omgevingen (AWS, GCP, Azure). Vervolgens presenteer je heldere dashboards en data-storytelling met verschillende BI-tools.

Bij Incentro blijf je groeien! Met een onbeperkt opleidingsbudget behaal je certificaten, vergroot je je expertise en deel je kennis via MeetUps en kennissessies. Je persoonlijke field manager helpt je bij je professionele ontwikkeling en carrièrepad.
✅ 3+ jaar ervaring als Data-analist of BI-analist
✅ Ervaring met BI-tools zoals Amazon QuickSight, Power BI, Looker (Studio) of Tableau
✅ Sterke SQL-skills (bonuspunten voor ervaring met Python en/of R)
✅ Ervaring met cloud platforms (Azure, AWS en/of GCP is een pre)
✅ Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal is essentieel voor deze functie
een vast contract bij de start
de mogelijkheid om 32 tot 40 u per week te werken
een onbeperkt opleidingsbudget om je data-guru ambitie te realiseren
een elektrische leaseauto of een extra €540,- bruto én km-vergoeding
een NS-Business Card voor je zakelijke reizen
27 vakantiedagen, 10 bij te kopen, vrije invulling religieuze vakantiedagen
elke 4 jaar €2700,- budget to pick-your-own laptop & gear
de mogelijkheid om aandeelhouder worden (en zo samen met 150+ andere collega's mede-eigenaar te zijn van Incentro)
een jaarlijkse winstuitkering, maandelijkse onkosten- & sportvergoeding en een tegemoetkoming voor het inrichten van je thuiswerkplek
een team waar serieuze aandacht is voor diversiteit & inclusie en waar je ondersteunt word bij zowel fysieke als mentale gezondheid
Dog-friendly office, dus neem die van jou gerust mee!
Met meer dan 15 jaar als Great Place To Work gecertificeerd en ons work-anywhere-anyplace-anytime-principe, staat jouw (werk)tevredenheid bij ons centraal.

Incentro biedt daarnaast nog veel meer. Samen organiseren we de nodige borrels, feestjes of meerdaagse ‘even-met-elkaar-weg’... Elk jaar gaan we samen op Wincentrosport, hebben we onze eigen kennis-conferentie in de vorm van IncentroCon en zien we collega’s gezamenlijk workations organiseren. Wil je meer weten over onze secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden? Kijk dan in ons handboek!

Incentro is een snelgroeiend bedrijf voor digitale diensten met meer dan 450 medewerkers, gevestigd in Kenia, Spanje, Bali en Nederland. Samen creëren we geweldige digitale oplossingen en maken we onze klanten klaar voor de strijd. Hoe krijgen we dit voor elkaar? Door onze mensen. We creëren ruimte om onze eigen keuzes te maken, te groeien en onze cultuur te borgen. Dit is precies waarom we sinds 2010 continu in de top 10 van Great Place to Work staan.

Heb je een passie voor data en werk je graag in verschillende, innovatieve omgevingen? Heb jij net als onze collega Bram een hekel aan pie-charts (of bewijs jij hem het nut van de pie-chart)?!. Kom werken bij Incentro en maak een significante impact op de business van onze klanten door middel van data-gedreven oplossingen.

Als Data analist bij Incentro speel je een sleutelrol binnen onze Data Solutions-cel, bestaande uit 40+ data experts. Samen helpen we klanten zoals PostNL, Bol, Simon Loos en Veiligheidsregio’s met hun data-uitdagingen.

4163464439,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analytics-traineeship-tilburg-at-people-x-4163464439?position=8&pageNum=5&refId=cO9ntLjWfa4M93hkvF9JeQ%3D%3D&trackingId=UVCNIyYWopXUJKxQdIzfRA%3D%3D,Data Analytics Traineeship Tilburg,People X,"Tilburg, North Brabant, Netherlands","For Dutch-speaking candidates only (C1 level in Dutch required)

Business Intelligence (BI) is het gehele proces rondom het verzamelen en structureren van data binnen een organisatie teneinde deze data om te zetten in bruikbare beslissingsondersteunende informatie (intelligence). Deze informatie kan vervolgens worden gevisualiseerd in een rapportage of dashboard met rapportagetools waardoor er beslissingen kunnen worden genomen op basis van feiten en cijfers.
Wij starten ieder kwartaal een Data Analytics Traineeship waarin jij door specialisten met ervaring uit de praktijk opgeleid wordt tot een Data Analist, Data Engineer of Data Consultant.

De eerste drie maanden word je fulltime opgeleid (theorie, examens en praktijk) door professionals uit het data vakgebied. Na de opleidingsperiode begeleiden wij je richting een passende opdrachtgever in de regio van jouw woonplaats. Hiervoor ga je in gesprek met opdrachtgevers waarvoor wij je uiteraard goed voorbereiden. Je kiest uiteindelijk zelf waar je wil gaan starten. Denk hierbij aan MKB bedrijven, gemeentelijke-, zorg- en onderwijs organisaties of top 500 bedrijven als Rabobank, TNO, VDL, Alliander, ONVZ, ASR, NOC*NSF, Van Lanschot, Achmea of Gazelle. Na ruim één jaar via People X te hebben gewerkt, treed je in dienst bij de opdrachtgever en maak je weer een stap in salaris.
Je werkzaamheden zijn uiteenlopend en inhoudelijk verschillend per opdrachtgever en branche waar je gaat werken, maar denk hierbij aan:
Het verzamelen, optimaliseren en inzichtelijk maken van bedrijfskundige data- en informatiestromen
Het in kaart brengen van de huidige en de gewenste situatie
Diverse KPI’s (prestatie indicatoren) opstellen, identificeren en visualiseren in BI rapportages of dashboards
Het opzetten en inrichten van een datawarehouse
Het schrijven van Business Rules in SQL
Op basis van je bevindingen advies geven over de huidige en toekomstige bedrijfsvoering
Helpen de organisatie bewuster te worden op het sturen op informatie (data driven).

Je zal hierbij gebruik maken van diverse Business Intelligence tools welke je in het traineeship geleerd krijgt. Communicatief vaardig zijn is belangrijk aangezien jij de juiste informatie en stromingen binnen een organisatie inzichtelijk moet maken door het stellen van de juiste vragen. Bedrijfskundig inzicht is dan ook van toegevoegde waarde.
Wat heeft People X jou te bieden?
Je wordt betaald vanaf dag 1 van het traineeship en ontvangt vanaf je inzet bij een opdrachtgever tussen de € 2750,- en € 3250,- bruto per maand o.b.v. 40 uur
Een specialistisch data traineeship gedoceerd door erkende gecertificeerde trainers
Het behalen van diverse erkende certificeringen die aansluiten op de behoefte in de markt: SQL, Power BI, Azure, Fabric en Scrum / Agile
Het behalen van drie officiële Microsoft Certified titels: Azure Fundamentals, Data Analyst Associate en Fabric Data Engineer Associate
Soft-, Business- en Vitaliteitstrainingen zodat je vanaf het begin stevig in je schoenen staat
Begeleiding en coaching vanuit een persoonlijke Talent Manager die zorgt voor een goede instroom en ontwikkeling bij de opdrachtgever waar je gaat starten
Een gedegen inwerktraject door een ervaren Data specialist en een groot kennisnetwerk van (oud) trainees, trainers en specialisten waar jij op terug kunt vallen en mee kan sparren
Baangarantie bij een toporganisatie in een branche die bij je past en uiteraard in de regio van je woonplaats
Tijdens en na het traineeship ontvang je een kilometervergoeding (€ 0,23) of een NS Businesscard

Een afgeronde wo bèta of bedrijfskundige opleiding of één van de volgende afgeronde bachelor / hbo studies: Informatica, ICT, Business IT & Management, Toegepaste Wiskunde of een vergelijkbare studie aangevuld met datakennis/toolkennis door zelfstudie
Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring, affiniteit en/of het enthousiasme richting Business Intelligence, data en/of databases
Praktische ervaring vanuit stage of studie met data gerelateerde programma’s als SPSS, Matlab, Python, R, Stata, VBA, SQL of vergelijkbaar
Je bent leergierig, analytisch, enthousiast, oplossingsgericht, zelfstandig en hebt de drive om je kennis up-to-date te houden
Je beschikt over goede communicatieve vaardigheden en beheerst naast de Nederlandse taal ook de Engelse taal

Je bent fulltime beschikbaar vanaf de start van het traineeship. Komt dit traineeship te vroeg? Je kunt via deze vacature ook alvast solliciteren voor een van de volgende traineeships. Op de website zie je alle actuele startdata. Geef bij je sollicitatie even aan voor welk traineeship je solliciteert.

• For Dutch-speaking candidates only (C1 level in Dutch required)

Business Intelligence (BI) is het gehele proces rondom het verzamelen en structureren van data binnen een organisatie teneinde deze data om te zetten in bruikbare beslissingsondersteunende informatie (intelligence). Deze informatie kan vervolgens worden gevisualiseerd in een rapportage of dashboard met rapportagetools waardoor er beslissingen kunnen worden genomen op basis van feiten en cijfers.

Wij starten ieder kwartaal een Data Analytics Traineeship waarin jij door specialisten met ervaring uit de praktijk opgeleid wordt tot een Data Analist, Data Engineer of Data Consultant.

De eerste drie maanden word je fulltime opgeleid (theorie, examens en praktijk) door professionals uit het data vakgebied. Na de opleidingsperiode begeleiden wij je richting een passende opdrachtgever in de regio van jouw woonplaats. Hiervoor ga je in gesprek met opdrachtgevers waarvoor wij je uiteraard goed voorbereiden. Je kiest uiteindelijk zelf waar je wil gaan starten. Denk hierbij aan MKB bedrijven, gemeentelijke-, zorg- en onderwijs organisaties of top 500 bedrijven als Rabobank, TNO, VDL, Alliander, ONVZ, ASR, NOC*NSF, Van Lanschot, Achmea of Gazelle. Na ruim één jaar via People X te hebben gewerkt, treed je in dienst bij de opdrachtgever en maak je weer een stap in salaris.

Functieomschrijving

Je werkzaamheden zijn uiteenlopend en inhoudelijk verschillend per opdrachtgever en branche waar je gaat werken, maar denk hierbij aan:

1

Het verzamelen, optimaliseren en inzichtelijk maken van bedrijfskundige data- en informatiestromen
column2:
2

Het in kaart brengen van de huidige en de gewenste situatie
column3:
3

Diverse KPI’s (prestatie indicatoren) opstellen, identificeren en visualiseren in BI rapportages of dashboards
column4:
4

Het opzetten en inrichten van een datawarehouse
column5:
5

Het schrijven van Business Rules in SQL
column6:
6

Op basis van je bevindingen advies geven over de huidige en toekomstige bedrijfsvoering
column7:
7

Helpen de organisatie bewuster te worden op het sturen op informatie (data driven).

Je zal hierbij gebruik maken van diverse Business Intelligence tools welke je in het traineeship geleerd krijgt. Communicatief vaardig zijn is belangrijk aangezien jij de juiste informatie en stromingen binnen een organisatie inzichtelijk moet maken door het stellen van de juiste vragen. Bedrijfskundig inzicht is dan ook van toegevoegde waarde.

Wat heeft People X jou te bieden?

1

Een traineeship van 1,5 jaar
column8:
2

Je wordt betaald vanaf dag 1 van het traineeship en ontvangt vanaf je inzet bij een opdrachtgever tussen de € 2750,- en € 3250,- bruto per maand o.b.v. 40 uur
column9:
3

Een specialistisch data traineeship gedoceerd door erkende gecertificeerde trainers
column10:
4

Het behalen van diverse erkende certificeringen die aansluiten op de behoefte in de markt: SQL, Power BI, Azure, Fabric en Scrum / Agile
column11:
5

Het behalen van drie officiële Microsoft Certified titels: Azure Fundamentals, Data Analyst Associate en Fabric Data Engineer Associate
column12:
6

Soft-, Business- en Vitaliteitstrainingen zodat je vanaf het begin stevig in je schoenen staat
column13:
7

Begeleiding en coaching vanuit een persoonlijke Talent Manager die zorgt voor een goede instroom en ontwikkeling bij de opdrachtgever waar je gaat starten
column14:
8

Een gedegen inwerktraject door een ervaren Data specialist en een groot kennisnetwerk van (oud) trainees, trainers en specialisten waar jij op terug kunt vallen en mee kan sparren
column15:
9

Baangarantie bij een toporganisatie in een branche die bij je past en uiteraard in de regio van je woonplaats
column16:
10

Tijdens en na het traineeship ontvang je een kilometervergoeding (€ 0,23) of een NS Businesscard
column17:
11

Een uitgebreide pensioenregeling.

Wat vragen wij?

1

Een afgeronde wo bèta of bedrijfskundige opleiding of één van de volgende afgeronde bachelor / hbo studies: Informatica, ICT, Business IT &
column18: Management, Toegepaste Wiskunde of een vergelijkbare studie aangevuld met datakennis/toolkennis door zelfstudie
column19:
2

Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring, affiniteit en/of het enthousiasme richting Business Intelligence, data en/of databases
column20:
3

Praktische ervaring vanuit stage of studie met data gerelateerde programma’s als SPSS, Matlab, Python, R, Stata, VBA, SQL of vergelijkbaar
column21:
4

Je bent leergierig, analytisch, enthousiast, oplossingsgericht, zelfstandig en hebt de drive om je kennis up-to-date te houden
column22:
5

Je beschikt over goede communicatieve vaardigheden en beheerst naast de Nederlandse taal ook de Engelse taal
column23:
6

Je bent fulltime beschikbaar vanaf de start van het traineeship. Komt dit traineeship te vroeg? Je kunt via deze vacature ook alvast solliciteren voor een van de volgende traineeships. Op de website zie je alle actuele startdata. Geef bij je sollicitatie even aan voor welk traineeship je solliciteert.

4153809292,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/bi-consultant-at-red-global-4153809292?position=1&pageNum=7&refId=%2ByclgFX2veQXBvUoSyHiQQ%3D%3D&trackingId=H1fqB2fw%2BXw5X5rp3Gw%2F%2FQ%3D%3D,BI Consultant,RED Global,"Rotterdam, South Holland, Netherlands","Voor onze internationale partner in de regio Rotterdam zijn wij op zoek naar een BI Consultant, die informatiebehoeften uit de business gaat achterhalen en vertalen naar de data afdeling, zodat zij door middel van het moderne dataplatform de juiste data producten kunnen ontwikkelen die de business verder helpen.
Herken jij jezelf hierin en spreekt het jou aan om te werken binnen een ondernemende omgeving?
Als BI Consultant ben jij de brug tussen de Business en de Data afdeling. Je taken zijn o.a.:

Business processen en informatiebehoeften achterhalen: Je werkt nauw samen met business afdelingen om hun processen en informatiebehoeften te begrijpen. Je stelt kritische vragen om de meest relevante business requirements te identificeren.
Use cases opstellen: Je zet de verzamelde informatie om in duidelijke use cases die je laat goedkeuren door de business.

Samenwerken met de Data afdeling: Je biedt de use cases aan bij de data afdeling, zodat zij de juiste data oplossingen kunnen ontwikkelen. Daarbij bespreek je met hen de aanvliegroute en challenge je hen om tot de best mogelijke uitkomsten te komen.
Voortgang monitoren en testen coördineren: Tijdens de ontwikkelfase houd je de voortgang in de gaten en coördineer je de testfase. Je begeleidt de uiteindelijke oplevering bij de business.

Stakeholder management. Jij bent de persoon die gemakkelijk schakelt met stakeholders van alle niveaus, die de omgeving durft te challengen, adviseren en begeleiden van a t/m z, waardoor jij een waardevolle toevoeging bent voor de organisatie.

Je hebt een bewezen trackrecord in een vergelijkbare rol waarbij je de schakel was tussen business en IT/Data, bijv. Informatie Analist, Functioneel Analist of Business Analist Aantoonbare kennis en ervaring met BI applicaties
Je beschikt over een sterke business achtergrond, waardoor je een serieuze gesprekspartner bent voor stakeholders uit de organisatie
Je bent analytisch ingesteld, kunt goed luisteren en bent een verbinder die graag samenwerkt
Wat jou typeert is je ondernemerschap
column2: je neemt initiatief, stelt vragen, stapt gemakkelijk op mensen af, bent pragmatisch en durft fouten te maken. En met jouw groei mindset zorg je er natuurlijk voor dat je die fout geen tweede keer maakt 😉

Voor onze internationale partner in de regio Rotterdam zijn wij op zoek naar een BI Consultant, die informatiebehoeften uit de business gaat achterhalen en vertalen naar de data afdeling, zodat zij door middel van het moderne dataplatform de juiste data producten kunnen ontwikkelen die de business verder helpen.


Herken jij jezelf hierin en spreekt het jou aan om te werken binnen een ondernemende omgeving?

Wat ga je doen?

Als BI Consultant ben jij de brug tussen de Business en de Data afdeling. Je taken zijn o.a.:


  • Business processen en informatiebehoeften achterhalen: Je werkt nauw samen met business afdelingen om hun processen en informatiebehoeften te begrijpen. Je stelt kritische vragen om de meest relevante business requirements te identificeren.
  • Use cases opstellen: Je zet de verzamelde informatie om in duidelijke use cases die je laat goedkeuren door de business.
  • Samenwerken met de Data afdeling: Je biedt de use cases aan bij de data afdeling, zodat zij de juiste data oplossingen kunnen ontwikkelen. Daarbij bespreek je met hen de aanvliegroute en challenge je hen om tot de best mogelijke uitkomsten te komen.

  • Stakeholder management. Jij bent de persoon die gemakkelijk schakelt met stakeholders van alle niveaus, die de omgeving durft te challengen, adviseren en begeleiden van a t/m z, waardoor jij een waardevolle toevoeging bent voor de organisatie.

  • Je hebt een bewezen trackrecord in een vergelijkbare rol waarbij je de schakel was tussen business en IT/Data, bijv. Informatie Analist, Functioneel Analist of Business Analist Aantoonbare kennis en ervaring met BI applicaties

Are you an experienced data & research leader with a passion for turning insights into impact? Do you thrive in a high-caliber, international environment where data drives business-critical decisions?

We are seeking a hands-on leader to shape and expand a newly established data research function, working at the intersection of executive search, leadership assessment, and organizational research. This is a unique opportunity to help build a cutting-edge, client-facing data research practice within a global firm renowned for advising C-level executives and boards.
Develop and oversee high-impact research projects, including white papers, data assets, and research-driven reports that influence key executive decisions
Engage with global clients, helping them understand cultural shifts, leadership trends, and organizational performance through data-driven insights
Work on both internal and external research projects, ensuring statistical rigor and insights
Collaborate with the data engineering team, product managers, and consultants to enhance methodologies, data validity, and research approaches
Mentor and manage a team of three data analysts, providing guidance and technical leadership.
Support the growth of a data research function, bringing together various data analytics efforts into a cohesive and business-driven strategy
5+ years of experience in a similar role
Master’s or PhD in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Data Science, Economics, or a related discipline
Research & Analytics – Strong background in statistical analysis, data validation, and hypothesis testing
SQL & Data Extraction – Experience in working with databases, retrieving and structuring data for research
Hands-on Leadership – Ability to both execute and oversee research projects, ensuring high-quality deliverables
Client-Facing Experience – Proven ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for executive-level stakeholders
Business-Minded & Strategic – Capable of aligning data-driven research with broader organizational goals
Professional & Polished – Adept at working in high-level corporate environments, delivering insights with clarity and impact
Build and shape an emerging research & data function from the ground up
Work in a highly international and intellectually stimulating environment
Direct impact on client decision-making at the highest level
Explore cutting-edge AI & ML applications in leadership analytics
A role that blends hands-on research, strategy, and leadership
Interested to learn more? Apply directly or reach out via LinkedIn for further discussion.

4149489296,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-analyst-at-selby-jennings-4149489296?position=5&pageNum=7&refId=%2ByclgFX2veQXBvUoSyHiQQ%3D%3D&trackingId=LtkML76zAKaA9s3bZVl9hQ%3D%3D,Quantitative Analyst,Selby Jennings,"Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands","The Role: Quantitative Analyst

An impact investment fund is seeking a new Quantitative Analyst to join their growing Business Development team. The Business Development team is pivotal in driving the company's growth and long-term vision through innovation, strategic initiatives, technology, and research. This role involves identifying and executing new opportunities, gathering insights from various departments, and supporting the front office with data and strategic direction.
Contribute to technology and infrastructure initiatives within the Business Development team, ensuring alignment with company goals.
Support the front office as a quantitative expert, developing and maintaining data analytics, portfolio management, and market analysis tools.
Play a key role in the pricing infrastructure, developing and maintaining tools used by the trading team, and contributing to the development of trade and data databases.
Validate quantitative models, provide input to relevant committees, and act as a liaison with external vendors supplying tools and platforms.
Strong quantitative background with proficiency in programming languages such as Python and VBA (C# is a plus).
At least 2 years of relevant experience in research, risk management, trading, or business development within a financial institution, with a focus on emerging markets.
Experience working with development finance institutions or related organizations, with an understanding of their mission and goals.
Advanced degree in mathematics, econometrics, or financial engineering, with a deep understanding of fixed-income and FX derivatives.
Excellent communication skills, a collaborative mindset, and a client-focused, solution-driven approach.

The Role: Quantitative Analyst
Location: Amsterdam, Netherlands

An impact investment fund is seeking a new Quantitative Analyst to join their growing Business Development team. The Business Development team is pivotal in driving the company's growth and long-term vision through innovation, strategic initiatives, technology, and research. This role involves identifying and executing new opportunities, gathering insights from various departments, and supporting the front office with data and strategic direction.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to technology and infrastructure initiatives within the Business Development team, ensuring alignment with company goals.
  • Support the front office as a quantitative expert, developing and maintaining data analytics, portfolio management, and market analysis tools.
  • Play a key role in the pricing infrastructure, developing and maintaining tools used by the trading team, and contributing to the development of trade and data databases.
  • Validate quantitative models, provide input to relevant committees, and act as a liaison with external vendors supplying tools and platforms.

Key Requirements:

  • Strong quantitative background with proficiency in programming languages such as Python and VBA (C# is a plus).
  • At least 2 years of relevant experience in research, risk management, trading, or business development within a financial institution, with a focus on emerging markets.
  • Experience working with development finance institutions or related organizations, with an understanding of their mission and goals.
  • Advanced degree in mathematics, econometrics, or financial engineering, with a deep understanding of fixed-income and FX derivatives.
  • Excellent communication skills, a collaborative mindset, and a client-focused, solution-driven approach.

4154576460,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analytics-expert-at-randstad-4154576460?position=10&pageNum=7&refId=%2ByclgFX2veQXBvUoSyHiQQ%3D%3D&trackingId=qYoWMrJjoPpT5Tds9j6%2BWg%3D%3D,Analytics Expert,Randstad,"Diemen, North Holland, Netherlands","Are you our new colleague?
We’re looking for a Analytics Expert at Randstad Global

The business risk and audit function (BR&AF) provides assurance and recommendations to the Executive Board and the Audit Committee on Randstad Group’s (risk) management, control and governance practices. Therefore the department facilitates in setting governance standards. It provides advice on internal control improvements, it conducts audits, special investigations and assignments worldwide on request of the Executive Board and Audit Committee. BR&AF’s responsibility includes the quarterly reporting based on: the risk and internal control self assessments, audit results, discussions on internal control weaknesses and analysis of the key risks reported throughout the company's management structure. This also substantiates the Group’s in-control statements.

The global function consists of team members operating through hubs spread over 4 continents. The team is organized in a matrix consisting of control & audit focus teams on business and functional areas (e.g. digital, talent, client, back office & shared service centers and fraud & forensics) and partners that are the linking pin to operating units (business risk & audit partners) with a global view. A support group is set up for professional practice, learning & development, quality improvement & methods, analytics and PMO.
Representatives of the different groups (Focus teams, BR&A Partners and support group) form the BR&AF core management team that reports to the Managing Director BR&AF.

You are part of the Business Risk & Audit Function (BR&AF) that covers all business operations related to Clients, Talents and our (shared) Back-, Mid- and Front offices, as well as our Accounting & Reporting and other specialist functions like HR. With your data analytics experience you enhance BR&AF's delivery to management bringing insight on Randstad's in-control situation.
support building and rolling out the BR&AF analytics roadmap.

perform technical data analytics, including data visualization, data reports, data cleansing scripts, and data validation as part audits, risk management, internal controls support and combined assurance projects and activities.

assist in taking the audit projects in Randstad to the next level through researching and evaluating new analytics concepts and technologies (e.g. generative AI/machine learning) in support of BR&F practices.
collaborate as an integrated part of audits teams in the definition and execution of analytics.
support non analytics professionals within the function growing their capabilities enabling them to leverage analytics more effectively.
are willing to travel. As the standard office locations for the BR&AF team are organized in hubs, like in the country mentioned, travelling is estimated to be about 20% to 30% of the job.
as co-creator support the analytics lead in the development and roll out the data analytics roadmap
lead the build out of the control structures to ensure sustainable analytics technology including data retention and clean up logic
participate in risk assessments, periodic sampling, and data-driven root cause analysis.

perform data analysis procedures, including data profiling, data mining, trend analysis, and predictive modeling. Apply statistical techniques and visualization tools to analyze large volumes of data and identify patterns, anomalies, and potential audit risks.
perform data collection, clean, analyze and report processes from various internal and external applications and databases, as well as other data sources when necessary.
interpret the results of data analysis and provide meaningful insights to audit teams and BR&AF management.
review and validate data analytics work performed by audit teams.
identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions as needed.
act as a resource for colleagues with less expertise.
partners/communities within applications operations and data management both at randstad global as well as in our operating companies
IT security, data protection, information security and business continuity communities within the Randstad organization.
BR&AF stakeholders/clients within the business including local MT's, process and control owners

You bring a hands-on and in depth understanding of data science and analytics concepts and structures combined with a drive to develop and roll out impactful analytics. With your drive for results you are able to balance short term delivery needs with mid term needs for standardization and sustainability of solutions. You understand the people, process, and technology dilemma's that go into building out analytics and are able to translate this into practical business cases both within the risk & audit function as well as over other functions.
have minimum 8 years of relevant experience
have minimum a master degree in business information management, computer science, or Mathematics and related accreditation (e.g. CAP/CDMP/CISA/CISSP)
have level BEC B1/B2 or higher Business English preferably combined with proficiency in one of the following languages: Dutch, Spanish, French, Italian and /or German
are experienced in international stakeholder management & change
are an innovative thinker that challenges the status quo
have an agile and flexible working style and passion for on the job coaching and development
have a pragmatic, realistic yet ambitious vision on analytics
deliver on the roll out of analytics through the 3 pillars of people, process and technology.
integrate technological developments into practices (e.g. generative AI)
effectively connect and take people with different backgrounds allowing non analytics experts to take ownership of initiatives and results
Within Randstad we defined the following Human Forward Leadership competencies:
delighting people: connect people (client, talent, employee, society), building strong client relationships and delivering client-centric solutions.
performing today: resourcefulness securing and developing resources effectively and efficiently.
leading change: manages ambiguity operating effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clear.
securing the future: drives vision and purpose painting a compelling picture of the vision and strategy that motivates others into action.

creating clarity: showing line of sight: making sense of complex, high quantity and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems and provides direction, is delegating and removing obstacles to get work done
courage to challenge: shows courage and confidence to speak up skillfully, challenging others even when they are confronted with resistance or unfamiliar circumstances

collaborates, reaches out, you excel in organizational sensitivity: manoeuvering comfortably through complex policy, process and people-related organizational dynamics recognizing the value that different perspectives and cultures bring to an organization
We put people at the heart of everything we do. Our employment conditions reflect this and are in accordance with the applicable (local) Randstad employment policies and related personnel guide.

We want our teams and talent to reflect the rich diversity of the societies we serve. We thrive for an environment of belonging, safety and confidence. So everyone can bring their whole selves to work and flourish. Learn more about equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging at randstad here.
people at the heart of everything we do

Working at Randstad is unlike working at any organization. Because at Randstad we put people at the heart of everything we do. This goes for our clients, our talent, our employees and society. We combine our passion for people with the power of today’s technologies. This helps us support people and organizations in realizing their true potential. We call this human forward.
Learn more about our mission, history and values on our website: www.randstad.com

If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role. For more information you can reach out to our recruitment business partner: jennifer.roberts@randstadsourceright.co.uk
The recruitment procedure consists of a screening and at least two interviews. Later in the process, an (online) assessment and a job offer conversation take place.

4164308125,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-zeeman-textielsupers-4164308125?position=1&pageNum=10&refId=Q56w94rc6YrqQ8wD0%2B%2BWlw%3D%3D&trackingId=itdWoKjggvxfnO7Hi3LVNQ%3D%3D,Data Engineer,Zeeman textielSupers,"Alphen aan Den Rijn, South Holland, Netherlands","Jouw rol als Data Engineer

Als Data Engineer zorg je ervoor dat je collega’s binnen Zeeman effectief gebruik kunnen maken van data door middel van een soepel ETL proces. Je gebruikt diverse databronnen, organiseert deze via ons Azure datalake en vormt deze om tot bruikbare data in ons Lakehouse. Je ontwikkelt scripts en algoritmes waarmee je de beschikbare data efficiënt bij elkaar brengt en organiseert via Microsoft Synapse.

Daarnaast ben je bezig met het implementeren van informatieproducten. Het uiteindelijke doel van deze functie is om informatieproducten op te leveren, waarmee je de Zeeman collega’s helpt om de juiste beslissingen te nemen. In deze rol heb je nauw contact met stakeholders aan de business kant. Je komt te werken in een relatief nieuw en groeiend team van data enthousiastelingen.
Het bouwen en optimaliseren van 'big data' datapijplijnen en architecturen
Het implementeren van efficiënte opslagmethoden op ons datalake
Het monitoren van de performance van ons datalake
Het soepel laten verlopen van verschillende laadprocessen binnen ons datalake
Het opbouwen van datasets binnen Synapse workspaces.

Zeeman is een retailorganisatie met inmiddels 1.300 winkels in 7 verschillende Europese landen. Wij richten ons op het aanbieden van kwalitatief goede producten tegen de laagst mogelijke prijs. We hechten veel belang aan Maatschappelijk Verantwoord Ondernemen en werken vanuit onze kernwaarden Eigenzinnig, Zuinig en Betrokken. Zeeman is een organisatie die zich kenmerkt door nuchterheid en doelgerichtheid, met de rijke historie en cultuur van een gezellig familiebedrijf. De menselijke maat telt, wat zich uit in respect voor elkaar, klanten en partners.

Het servicekantoor van Zeeman is gevestigd in Alphen aan den Rijn. Op dit kantoor werken momenteel zo'n 300 medewerkers. Het IT-team en het Data Competence Center, spelen een belangrijke rol bij het faciliteren van de groei van Zeeman. Mede hierom maken wij de omslag naar een data driven organisatie. Jij maakt deel uit van het Data Competence Center.
Minimaal HBO werk- en denkniveau, bij voorkeur in een relevante studierichting
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als (Big) Data Engineer
Ervaring met relationele SQL databases, waaronder SQLServer
Ervaring met Synapse en Google Big Query is een pré
Ervaring met Spark en Delta Lake is een pré
Ervaring met datapijplijn en werkstroommanagement hulpmiddelen zoals bijvoorbeeld SSIS, Datafactory, Powershell, Azure Release Management en DevOps (git).
Een werkomgeving waarin je continu wordt uitgedaagd
Een vast salaris tussen de €5.020,- en €6.792,- bruto per maand
Een bonusregeling van 12,5% per jaar (afhankelijk van het behaalde resultaat)
24 vakantiedagen + 12 ATV dagen (op basis van fulltime)
Hybride werken (met een standaard thuiswerkvergoeding per werkdag)
Toegang tot ons e-learning platform waar je onbeperkt trainingen kunt volgen
Een werkgever waar Maatschappelijk Verantwoord Ondernemen en het belang van medewerkers zeer hoog op de agenda staan.

Jouw rol als Data Engineer

Als Data Engineer zorg je ervoor dat je collega’s binnen Zeeman effectief gebruik kunnen maken van data door middel van een soepel ETL proces. Je gebruikt diverse databronnen, organiseert deze via ons Azure datalake en vormt deze om tot bruikbare data in ons Lakehouse. Je ontwikkelt scripts en algoritmes waarmee je de beschikbare data efficiënt bij elkaar brengt en organiseert via Microsoft Synapse.

Daarnaast ben je bezig met het implementeren van informatieproducten. Het uiteindelijke doel van deze functie is om informatieproducten op te leveren, waarmee je de Zeeman collega’s helpt om de juiste beslissingen te nemen. In deze rol heb je nauw contact met stakeholders aan de business kant. Je komt te werken in een relatief nieuw en groeiend team van data enthousiastelingen.


Jouw voornaamste verantwoordelijkheden:

  • Het bouwen en optimaliseren van 'big data' datapijplijnen en architecturen

Being part of an international company yet with local presence
Build a safer digital society together with us

Within Orange Cyberdefense we are looking for a PowerBI administrator for the support and development of business critical reporting. We are looking to find an experienced PowerBI administrator, with knowledge of Microsoft Fabric to join our global application team.

You will become part of a highly motivated team responsible for the development of our new global ERP architecture, integrations between business applications and the reporting on top of those applications.

In this role you will have extensive contact with the different internal stakeholders and end-users across the business and will also be gathering requirements from them, as well as supporting them in the use of reports. Together with the BI Architect, you will build the data warehouse and the data models to support these reporting requirements.
You have a bachelor working and thinking level and preferably comparable work experience in an ICT service organization
In-depth knowledge of and experience with PowerBI, ideally also with Microsoft Fabric.
Experience with ERP systems would be an advantage.
You have good command of the English language, both in word and in writing

Some highlights

  • Being part of an international company yet with local presence
  • Build a safer digital society together with us

Working as a PowerBI Administrator

Within Orange Cyberdefense we are looking for a PowerBI administrator for the support and development of business critical reporting. We are looking to find an experienced PowerBI administrator, with knowledge of Microsoft Fabric to join our global application team.

You will become part of a highly motivated team responsible for the development of our new global ERP architecture, integrations between business applications and the reporting on top of those applications.

In this role you will have extensive contact with the different internal stakeholders and end-users across the business and will also be gathering requirements from them, as well as supporting them in the use of reports. Together with the BI Architect, you will build the data warehouse and the data models to support these reporting requirements.

What we expect of you

  • You have a bachelor working and thinking level and preferably comparable work experience in an ICT service organization
  • In-depth knowledge of and experience with PowerBI, ideally also with Microsoft Fabric.
  • Experience with ERP systems would be an advantage.
  • You have good command of the English language, both in word and in writing

4142376266,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/asset-data-analyst-6-9-months-at-nlighten-4142376266?position=6&pageNum=10&refId=Q56w94rc6YrqQ8wD0%2B%2BWlw%3D%3D&trackingId=6Jxcn3TFGGDfH5fghtQtkg%3D%3D,Asset Data Analyst ( 6-9 months),nLighten,"North Holland, Netherlands","Company Profile

nLighten is a digital infrastructure platform and a portfolio company of I Squared Capital, providing best-in-class network access to organizations, private users, and the mobile workforce. We offer low-latency, innovative power solutions, diverse connectivity, and reliable, secure infrastructure for high-volume real-time data processing.

In the era of digital transformation, we at nLighten understand the growing need for edge data center partners that can adapt to evolving technological advancements such as AI and IoT. Our edge data centers, spread across Europe, are designed with both efficiency and environmental impact in mind. Founded in 2021 by a team with deep expertise in the data center industry, our mission is to set a new standard for sustainable and future-ready data centers.

We are looking for a Data Analyst – Asset Management to support a key temporary project integrating physical and IT assets into Salesforce. This role is ideal for someone with experience managing data center assets, IT infrastructure, or telecommunications equipment.

The Data Analyst will work closely with multiple teams, including Operations, IT, and Asset Management, to ensure accurate data collection, input, and visualization. You will be responsible for structuring large datasets, refining asset tracking, and developing user-friendly dashboards for clear reporting. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to an innovative and growing company at the forefront of digital infrastructure.
Collect, analyze, and manage asset-related data from multiple sources.
Input and structure asset data accurately within Salesforce.
Ensure consistency and accuracy in asset tracking, especially for data center, IT, and telecommunications infrastructure.
Review and analyze customer agreements to maintain accurate records.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards for data visualization and reporting.
Conduct ad hoc analyses to support evolving business needs.
Assist with integration of new projects, systems, and data models.
Support the Operations team with data, reporting, and analytical insights.
Provide data-driven recommendations to key stakeholders.
Experience in asset management within data centers, IT, telecommunications, or infrastructure industries is preferred.
Previous experience (minimum 3 years) in asset management, data analysis, or a similar role.
Salesforce experience is a strong plus.
Experience with iTop or similar asset management (IBM Maximo) tools is a strong plus.
Advanced proficiency in handling large datasets and data modeling.
Strong command of MS Excel and the full MS Office suite.
Excellent analytical skills, attention to detail, and a problem-solving mindset.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills to collaborate across teams.

column2: strong proficiency in French is highly preferred for reading and responding to documents

column1: Be part of an innovative, fast-growing company shaping the future of digital infrastructure.
Work on impactful projects with cutting-edge data center technologies.
Gain hands-on experience with Salesforce integrations and asset management.
Join a collaborative and dynamic environment where your insights drive real change.
If you have the right experience and are excited about contributing to the next evolution of edge data centers, we’d love to hear from you!
Apply now and be part of our journey toward a more connected, efficient, and sustainable digital future.

Company Profile

nLighten is a digital infrastructure platform and a portfolio company of I Squared Capital, providing best-in-class network access to organizations, private users, and the mobile workforce. We offer low-latency, innovative power solutions, diverse connectivity, and reliable, secure infrastructure for high-volume real-time data processing.

In the era of digital transformation, we at nLighten understand the growing need for edge data center partners that can adapt to evolving technological advancements such as AI and IoT. Our edge data centers, spread across Europe, are designed with both efficiency and environmental impact in mind. Founded in 2021 by a team with deep expertise in the data center industry, our mission is to set a new standard for sustainable and future-ready data centers.

Learn more about us: www.nlighten.eu


About the Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst – Asset Management to support a key temporary project integrating physical and IT assets into Salesforce. This role is ideal for someone with experience managing data center assets, IT infrastructure, or telecommunications equipment.

The Data Analyst will work closely with multiple teams, including Operations, IT, and Asset Management, to ensure accurate data collection, input, and visualization. You will be responsible for structuring large datasets, refining asset tracking, and developing user-friendly dashboards for clear reporting. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to an innovative and growing company at the forefront of digital infrastructure.


Key Responsibilities

  • Collect, analyze, and manage asset-related data from multiple sources.
  • Input and structure asset data accurately within Salesforce.
  • Ensure consistency and accuracy in asset tracking, especially for data center, IT, and telecommunications infrastructure.
  • Review and analyze customer agreements to maintain accurate records.
  • Develop and maintain interactive dashboards for data visualization and reporting.
  • Conduct ad hoc analyses to support evolving business needs.
  • Assist with integration of new projects, systems, and data models.
  • Support the Operations team with data, reporting, and analytical insights.
  • Provide data-driven recommendations to key stakeholders.


What We’re Looking For

  • Experience in asset management within data centers, IT, telecommunications, or infrastructure industries is preferred.
  • Previous experience (minimum 3 years) in asset management, data analysis, or a similar role.
  • Salesforce experience is a strong plus.
  • Experience with iTop or similar asset management (IBM Maximo) tools is a strong plus.
  • Advanced proficiency in handling large datasets and data modeling.
  • Strong command of MS Excel and the full MS Office suite.
  • Excellent analytical skills, attention to detail, and a problem-solving mindset.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills to collaborate across teams.
  • Fluency in English is required
column2:
strong proficiency in French is highly preferred for reading and responding to documents


Why Join Us?

  • Be part of an innovative, fast-growing company shaping the future of digital infrastructure.
  • Work on impactful projects with cutting-edge data center technologies.
  • Gain hands-on experience with Salesforce integrations and asset management.
  • Join a collaborative and dynamic environment where your insights drive real change.


If you have the right experience and are excited about contributing to the next evolution of edge data centers, we’d love to hear from you!


Apply now and be part of our journey toward a more connected, efficient, and sustainable digital future.

4138966731,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-officer-at-reef-4138966731?position=7&pageNum=10&refId=Q56w94rc6YrqQ8wD0%2B%2BWlw%3D%3D&trackingId=ttsE4sIROeYFXbOm1PYxkA%3D%3D,Business Intelligence officer,REEF,"Veldhoven, North Brabant, Netherlands","Voor onze Partner Geevers Auto Parts zijn wij op zoek naar een Business Intelligence Officer

Welkom in de dynamische wereld van Geevers Auto Parts, bij ons is geen enkele dag hetzelfde! Zie jij het als een uitdaging om business intelligence activiteiten van Geevers Auto Parts verder te professionaliseren? Weet jij data te structureren, beheren en te rapporteren en weet je ook het overzicht te bewaren? Kun jij verbeteringen doorvoeren in de business en financiële processen? Als je dan ook nog snel kunt schakelen met interne en externe stakeholders dan is deze baan iets voor jou! Ons team is op zoek naar een Business Intelligence Officer voor 32 – 40 uur per week.
Zorg je ervoor dat we gebruik kunnen maken van een gezond en up and running datawarehouse en zorg je voor onderhoud van de governance en documentatie en het aankoppelen van nieuwe systemen
Bepaal je de gevolgen en impact op performance van het datawarehouse bij veranderingen in processen, software en infrastructuur
Draag je bij aan het verder ontwikkelen, verbeteren en bijhouden van het data model met data definities
Inventariseer je zowel proactief als op verzoek de informatiebehoeften van de business en vertaalt deze in dashboards en onderliggende rapporten en KPI’s
Draag je bij aan het inrichten, modelleren, verbeteren en optimaliseren van de interne bedrijfsprocessen en -procedures
Heb je een actieve rol in het maken van de blauwdruk en het implementeren van een nieuw ERP systeem binnen het bedrijf
Weet draagvlak voor veranderingen te creëren
Je hebt een continue focus op persoonlijke ontwikkeling en een drive voor het verbeteren van bedrijfsprocessen. Verder ben je analytisch onderlegd en beschik je over:
BI: Specifiek sterke kennis van SQL (queries, stored procedures) en Power BI gerelateerde tools en functies (zoals DAX)
Ervaring in data governance en het ontwikkelen en inrichten van een datawarehouse
Sterke ervaring met Azure DevOps, Portal en Data Factory
Kennis van UiPath is een pre
Marktconform salaris met bijbehorende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden incl. winstdeling en fietsenplan
Prettige werksfeer, leuke collega’s, al zeggen wij het zelf!
Iedere vrijdag een vrijdagmiddagafsluiting met collega’s
Spreekt deze vacature jou aan? Reageer dan snel en wellicht ben jij wel onze nieuwe collega!
Mail jouw motivatie en cv naar: e.emmen@reef.nl of m.meiboom@reef.nl

Geevers Auto Parts is DE specialist op het gebied van onderdelen voor schadeherstel. Van advies tot logistieke dienstverlening en van het leveren van reparatie-onderdelen tot het vervoer van schadegevoelige auto-onderdelen. Met meer dan 200 professionele medewerkers zijn we al 50 jaar in staat om de kwaliteit te blijven leveren die onze klanten gewend zijn en hebben wij een sterke ambitie om de komende jaren verder te blijven groeien. Onze klantenservice is zeer gespecialiseerd en helpt u bij het vinden van de juiste onderdelen, zodat u snel kunt starten met repareren. Dát is waar we goed in zijn, daarin onderscheiden we ons. Op doordeweekse dagen zijn we 24 uur per dag bereikbaar. In ons centrale magazijn van 40.000 m² in Veldhoven hebben we standaard maar liefst 100.000 verschillende onderdelen op voorraad. De schadedelen van 35 automerken zijn direct uit voorraad leverbaar. Alle overige merken zijn na bestelling vrijwel altijd binnen 24 uur leverbaar. We verzorgen de complete logistieke dienstverlening en hebben meer dan 50 chauffeurs continu op de weg om onderdelen te bezorgen. Het vervoer van schadegevoelige onderdelen zoals bijv. autoruiten is daarbij ons specialisme.

Voor onze Partner Geevers Auto Parts zijn wij op zoek naar een Business Intelligence Officer


Welkom in de dynamische wereld van Geevers Auto Parts, bij ons is geen enkele dag hetzelfde! Zie jij het als een uitdaging om business intelligence activiteiten van Geevers Auto Parts verder te professionaliseren? Weet jij data te structureren, beheren en te rapporteren en weet je ook het overzicht te bewaren? Kun jij verbeteringen doorvoeren in de business en financiële processen? Als je dan ook nog snel kunt schakelen met interne en externe stakeholders dan is deze baan iets voor jou! Ons team is op zoek naar een Business Intelligence Officer voor 32 – 40 uur per week.



Hoofdwerkzaamheden:


  • Zorg je ervoor dat we gebruik kunnen maken van een gezond en up and running datawarehouse en zorg je voor onderhoud van de governance en documentatie en het aankoppelen van nieuwe systemen
  • Bepaal je de gevolgen en impact op performance van het datawarehouse bij veranderingen in processen, software en infrastructuur
  • Draag je bij aan het verder ontwikkelen, verbeteren en bijhouden van het data model met data definities
  • Inventariseer je zowel proactief als op verzoek de informatiebehoeften van de business en vertaalt deze in dashboards en onderliggende rapporten en KPI’s
  • Draag je bij aan het inrichten, modelleren, verbeteren en optimaliseren van de interne bedrijfsprocessen en -procedures
  • Heb je een actieve rol in het maken van de blauwdruk en het implementeren van een nieuw ERP systeem binnen het bedrijf


Competenties:


  • Communicatief vaardig
  • Weet draagvlak voor veranderingen te creëren
  • Resultaat- en verbeteringsgericht, daadkrachtig
  • Flexibel
  • Initiatief nemen
  • Accuraat en gezond kritisch
  • Energiek met een positieve instelling


Wij vragen wij?


Je hebt een continue focus op persoonlijke ontwikkeling en een drive voor het verbeteren van bedrijfsprocessen. Verder ben je analytisch onderlegd en beschik je over:



  • HBO/WO niveau
  • BI: Specifiek sterke kennis van SQL (queries, stored procedures) en Power BI gerelateerde tools en functies (zoals DAX)
  • Ervaring in data governance en het ontwikkelen en inrichten van een datawarehouse
  • Sterke ervaring met Azure DevOps, Portal en Data Factory
  • Kennis van UiPath is een pre
  • Analytisch sterk


Wat mag je verwachten?


  • Marktconform salaris met bijbehorende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden incl. winstdeling en fietsenplan
  • Ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling
  • Prettige werksfeer, leuke collega’s, al zeggen wij het zelf!
  • Iedere vrijdag een vrijdagmiddagafsluiting met collega’s


Spreekt deze vacature jou aan? Reageer dan snel en wellicht ben jij wel onze nieuwe collega!



Interesse?


Mail jouw motivatie en cv naar: e.emmen@reef.nl of m.meiboom@reef.nl


Over Geevers Auto Parts:

Van advies tot logistieke dienstverlening en van het leveren van reparatie-onderdelen tot het vervoer van schadegevoelige auto-onderdelen. Met meer dan 200 professionele medewerkers zijn we al 50 jaar in staat om de kwaliteit te blijven leveren die onze klanten gewend zijn en hebben wij een sterke ambitie om de komende jaren verder te blijven groeien. Onze klantenservice is zeer gespecialiseerd en helpt u bij het vinden van de juiste onderdelen, zodat u snel kunt starten met repareren. Dát is waar we goed in zijn, daarin onderscheiden we ons. Op doordeweekse dagen zijn we 24 uur per dag bereikbaar. In ons centrale magazijn van 40.000 m² in Veldhoven hebben we standaard maar liefst 100.000 verschillende onderdelen op voorraad. De schadedelen van 35 automerken zijn direct uit voorraad leverbaar. Alle overige merken zijn na bestelling vrijwel altijd binnen 24 uur leverbaar. We verzorgen de complete logistieke dienstverlening en hebben meer dan 50 chauffeurs continu op de weg om onderdelen te bezorgen. Het vervoer van schadegevoelige onderdelen zoals bijv. autoruiten is daarbij ons specialisme.

4163431580,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/open-application-amsterdam-at-gerimedica-4163431580?position=1&pageNum=12&refId=FWpl0oDulLMXJ0ZTEcvioA%3D%3D&trackingId=nM3y5imGv7FlrVPwgl8P%2Fg%3D%3D,"Open application, Amsterdam",Gerimedica,"Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands","Are you ready to make Dutch healthcare better? Are you passionate about healthcare and making an impact? If you have the same open mind set as we have, no matter where you come from, Gerimedica might be your future employer.

If you have taken a look at our current vacancies, but haven’t found anything that suits you or just want to apply in a few months or a year, then drop here your application and your motivational letter for the respective function/position you are interested in.
Below you can find a nice overview of all of our teams and positions within Gerimedica.
Gerimedica is evolving fast, we currently have 5 development teams. Our teams work on 2 main projects: Ysis EPD and Ysis ECD.

Three (3) of our teams are working on Ysis EPD. They work e.g. on authentication, authorisations and financial applications, but also on integration of Ysis with different partners and on the interoperability with some country-wide standards for key organizations.
The last two (2) teams are working on a new ECD, a product just released in production that is focusing on non-medical care for geriatric and mentally disabled patients.

All developers work full stack, which means that while you will have more experience in front-end development, you will also have the opportunity to explore back-end functionalities as well in Java 17 and Spring boot. In order to provide a clean and simple front-end and its supporting functionality, you’ll be collaborating with our UX/UI designers so that the best possible solutions are implemented. You will work in an agile scrum-based environment, with a Product Owner, UI/UX designer, a Scrum Master and a team of excellent developers.

A team of highly skilled full stack developers, all with different skill sets and expertise (front-end and back-end). They are responsible for highlighting and implementing solutions based upon business requirements provided by industry leaders. They create high quality, well designed, maintainable and efficient code. Our developers work in an agile scrum-based environment, with a product owner, architect, scrum master and a team of excellent developers.

Our Designers work closely with multiple agile teams, collaborating with the different product owners to solve UX challenges and with our front-end engineers defining and scaling UI elements across all our solutions. They are responsible for leading a human centric design process, balancing the user and the business needs with the aim to improve the overall user experience and evolve our solutions. We currently have two designers working closely with our teams.

Our QA Engineers work with a team of highly skilled developers and within a testing team of other experienced testers. Our software is used for patient care thus quality testing is a high priority at Gerimedica. They focus on two main aspects: improving our test automation system ànd providing manual testing support for newly developed functionality. They are responsible for functional, regression and automation testing to make sure we proactively identify and resolve issues, and they help to maintain QA documentation and tooling, build product test strategies, write and execute plans with schedules and dependencies.

We currently have a team of two system administrators, who are our internal service team. They are responsible for onboarding and offboarding of new team members (i.e. from taking care that the needed hardware is in house when the new colleague joins, providing access and accounts for all the needed framework including our internal VPN, and supporting during the onboarding for all the questions that might arise). They also support the whole office for internal requests: network, printers, laptops, wifi, fix computers issues (hardware and software), maintain the office network, and prepare and maintain office equipment, computers, services for meeting rooms and conferences (video and audio systems, big touch screens, projectors, TVs, and etc.).

Our Product Owners (one PO per team) are part of the development team, they are the voice of the end user and ensure that their vision is known and followed by other important stakeholders. Their stakeholder management is therefore very important, both internally and towards the healthcare employees who work with Ysis. They are responsible for the roadmap in which we would like to see how we can add value in both the short and long term. With their knowledge they are able to understand the needs and pain points of users (organisations) like no other!

We currently have two Scrum Masters who work with our five development teams. Their main responsibility is making our development teams adopt the rules of Scrum and other useful techniques, in a way that best fits their current needs. They do so by facilitating scrum events, coaching the teams and organisation in the agile way of working and scrum practices, and by ensuring that the teams are healthy, productive, and motivated.

As the name suggests, our R&D team not only develops but also researches possible solutions. As an R&D Engineer or Data Scientist in the R&D department you are very interested in the latest developments and newest technologies in the online world. You will be working together in a small team of like-minded people in close cooperation with the Head of R&D. You will be in frequent contact with our existing development teams.

Our HR team is a small team of four motivated people that work hand in hand to support the teams and its members and create an optimal working environment for Gerimedica. Belinda (HR Manager) and Maria (HR Assistant) are focusing on HR best practices and activities, and Marieta (Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist) and Vanessa (Talent Acquisition Specialist) on recruitment activities and talent acquisition projects.

Our service desk and help desk teams are small and close-knit. Their team culture is best described as free, open, social and based on trust. They are happy to help our customers, and because of the required product knowledge, they all have our own focus area
column2: based on this knowledge we distribute the questions. Together with the helpdesk team, we are always looking for ways to further improve our services.

column1: As a Service Desk, they are Gerimedica's calling card. Our service desk is the first point of contact for our customers' application managers and superusers. An important role, because the sooner and better we can help our customers, the sooner they can focus again on what we all do it for: providing good care to the clients. Our support specialists have regular contact with our various customers and spend a majority of their time tackling customers’ questions and concerns.

The Support department is the department where technical knowledge of Ysis is used to answer questions from customers. When customers have questions or experience problems, they report to the Service Desk. Is the question very specialist? Then a request comes to the second line and it's their turn. They ensure correct prioritisation and timely handling, and they maintain contact with the customer themselves.

Our advisor's team is the main point of contact for our customers. These customers are care institutions in elderly care and care for people with intellectual disabilities. They use our treatment file (EPD) Ysis and also our new care file (Ysis ECD). Our goal is to ensure that healthcare professionals can focus more on their profession. Because our advisors know our customers through and through, they actively contribute to thinking about improvements and innovations in our software. Together we ensure that our software fits seamlessly with the daily practice of the user.

You will be part of a team of advisors, in which account managers and project managers work daily to contribute to our mission: to support healthcare professionals in providing the best possible care. The team consists of motivated and talented professionals who challenge each other to develop personally and as a team.

As an expert in the field of care and treatment in chronic care, our account managers are an important point of contact for all healthcare institutions that use Ysis, the multidisciplinary treatment file developed by GeriMedica. They are often on location at these institutions to advise on the use of Ysis. They provide training, give demos, supervise implementation projects and act as a source of information for the project leaders and users in the institution. The account managers work independently, both with customers and at the office in Amsterdam. They think along about improvements and innovations in our software to ensure that it fits seamlessly with the daily practice of the user. They also play an active role in the development and implementation of our newly developed care file!

As an expert in the field of care and treatment in chronic care, you are an important point of contact for all healthcare institutions that use Ysis. You inspire and enthuse (new) customers to work with Ysis and get the most out of it. You know how to explain the value of Ysis well and you take that into account when setting up the application. You are often on location at healthcare institutions to advise on the use of Ysis. You supervise implementation projects, provide training and give demos. You are the source of information for the project leaders and users in the healthcare institution. You work independently, both with customers and at the office in Amsterdam. Our customers are located throughout the Netherlands, so traveling is part of the job. Finally: you think along about improvements and innovations in our software to ensure that it fits seamlessly with the daily practice of the user.

In Gerimedica Inzicht we invite you to help build the future of care for the elderly and mentally disabled in the Netherlands. Our software is used by healthcare professionals to access complete patient information, so they can optimise their work processes. On top of that, thanks to algorithms, AI and medical data, our users know and see more than ever before. Our data platform continuously maps the health of clients and provides this information back to the users of our EPD, namely doctors, paramedics and nurses, at the right time. If you think it would be a fun challenge to improve the care provided to the elderly and the mentally disabled with the help of data in the role of Business Intelligence Consultant or Customer Success Manager, we would like to talk to you!
What you bring to the table
A permanent, 40 hour contract per week (32 hours is also an option)
Good work life balance, a combination of remote working and working in our beautiful office in Amsterdam
The best colleagues from all over the world
A high end laptop of you choice and a modern development environment
Free lunch and fruit in the office or a working from home allowance
Individual training budget to expand your knowledge and skills
Depending on the position and function there are some additional benefits

Please apply via the button below and upload your CV and cover letter (we want to learn even more about you, why you are interested in Gerimedica, and what position/department you would be interested in). In case of questions, please ask Marieta Karagianni (via de button ""Solliciteer nu"" op deze pagina., ). We are looking forward to receiving your application!

Are you ready to make Dutch healthcare better? Are you passionate about healthcare and making an impact? If you have the same open mind set as we have, no matter where you come from, Gerimedica might be your future employer.

1st Line Support (Helpdesk/Service desk)

As a Service Desk, they are Gerimedica's calling card. Our service desk is the first point of contact for our customers' application managers and superusers. An important role, because the sooner and better we can help our customers, the sooner they can focus again on what we all do it for: providing good care to the clients. Our support specialists have regular contact with our various customers and spend a majority of their time tackling customers’ questions and concerns.

2nd Line Technical Support

The Support department is the department where technical knowledge of Ysis is used to answer questions from customers. When customers have questions or experience problems, they report to the Service Desk. Is the question very specialist? Then a request comes to the second line and it's their turn. They ensure correct prioritisation and timely handling, and they maintain contact with the customer themselves.

Advisors

Our advisor's team is the main point of contact for our customers. These customers are care institutions in elderly care and care for people with intellectual disabilities. They use our treatment file (EPD) Ysis and also our new care file (Ysis ECD). Our goal is to ensure that healthcare professionals can focus more on their profession. Because our advisors know our customers through and through, they actively contribute to thinking about improvements and innovations in our software. Together we ensure that our software fits seamlessly with the daily practice of the user.

You will be part of a team of advisors, in which account managers and project managers work daily to contribute to our mission: to support healthcare professionals in providing the best possible care. The team consists of motivated and talented professionals who challenge each other to develop personally and as a team.

Account Managers

As an expert in the field of care and treatment in chronic care, our account managers are an important point of contact for all healthcare institutions that use Ysis, the multidisciplinary treatment file developed by GeriMedica. They are often on location at these institutions to advise on the use of Ysis. They provide training, give demos, supervise implementation projects and act as a source of information for the project leaders and users in the institution. The account managers work independently, both with customers and at the office in Amsterdam. They think along about improvements and innovations in our software to ensure that it fits seamlessly with the daily practice of the user. They also play an active role in the development and implementation of our newly developed care file!

Implementation Consultants

As an expert in the field of care and treatment in chronic care, you are an important point of contact for all healthcare institutions that use Ysis. You inspire and enthuse (new) customers to work with Ysis and get the most out of it. You know how to explain the value of Ysis well and you take that into account when setting up the application. You are often on location at healthcare institutions to advise on the use of Ysis. You supervise implementation projects, provide training and give demos. You are the source of information for the project leaders and users in the healthcare institution. You work independently, both with customers and at the office in Amsterdam. Our customers are located throughout the Netherlands, so traveling is part of the job. Finally: you think along about improvements and innovations in our software to ensure that it fits seamlessly with the daily practice of the user.

Gerimedica Inzicht

In Gerimedica Inzicht we invite you to help build the future of care for the elderly and mentally disabled in the Netherlands. Our software is used by healthcare professionals to access complete patient information, so they can optimise their work processes. On top of that, thanks to algorithms, AI and medical data, our users know and see more than ever before. Our data platform continuously maps the health of clients and provides this information back to the users of our EPD, namely doctors, paramedics and nurses, at the right time. If you think it would be a fun challenge to improve the care provided to the elderly and the mentally disabled with the help of data in the role of Business Intelligence Consultant or Customer Success Manager, we would like to talk to you!

Functie-eisen

What you bring to the table

  • Great communication skills
  • Motivation and enthusiasm
  • Passion about your work!

What You Get From Us

  • A competitive salary
  • A permanent, 40 hour contract per week (32 hours is also an option)
  • Good work life balance, a combination of remote working and working in our beautiful office in Amsterdam
  • The best colleagues from all over the world
  • A high end laptop of you choice and a modern development environment
  • Contribution to your pension scheme
  • 25 holidays
  • Free lunch and fruit in the office or a working from home allowance
  • Individual training budget to expand your knowledge and skills
  • Depending on the position and function there are some additional benefits

If you are interested

Please apply via the button below and upload your CV and cover letter (we want to learn even more about you, why you are interested in Gerimedica, and what position/department you would be interested in). In case of questions, please ask Marieta Karagianni (via de button ""Solliciteer nu"" op deze pagina., ). We are looking forward to receiving your application!

4150455893,https://nl.linkedin.com/jobs/view/marketing-data-insights-analyst-at-tbauctions-4150455893?position=2&pageNum=12&refId=FWpl0oDulLMXJ0ZTEcvioA%3D%3D&trackingId=0mBsmZREt0PSSNBocRC3eA%3D%3D,Marketing Data & Insights Analyst,TBAuctions,Amsterdam Area,"At TBAuctions, we are committed to driving our online auction platform using data. We aim to understand the key drivers, measure our performance, predict future trends, and initiate improvements and innovations based on our insights. TBAuctions contains out of various brands which gain from insights to create better strategy and general decision making .

As a Marketing Data & Insights Analyst with continental focus, your analytical mind and passion for data make you the perfect candidate to proactively provide the business with relevant and actionable insights. You will achieve this by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting the right data and translating it into meaningful conclusions. This role main focus in 2025 is setting up marketing report across brands, generate insights which can be acted on.

Based in Amsterdam, with regular travel to Dusseldorf and occasional travel to other European countries, you will report to marketing director and collaborate with the brand marketing teams and the group data team.
This is what you will do:
Collaborate with various teams in marketing across brands, and group marketing providing them with insights to better understand and explain their business.
Build and manage KPI dashboards that other teams like performance marketing rely on for decision-making
Analyze existing data to uncover trends and actionable insights with attention to detail.
Communicate your findings to the rest of the company and drive change in the product and our proposition. Insights are valuable, but the impact is even better!
Evaluate campaign performance by defining and managing KPIs aligned with goals
5+ years of analytics with focus in marketing
Familiar with concept as attribution and ROI
Ability to identify product and business opportunities through data and clearly communicate them to colleagues.
Familiar with tooling as Google Analytics, Segment etc.
Skilled at transforming raw data into a wealth of opportunities.
SQL, Python, Databricks, Power BI, and Excel
Tackle ad hoc requests with curiosity and creativity, delivering quick, impactful insights with minimal support
Proficient at translating business questions into analytical questions and sharing insights with colleagues.
Write clean, understandable code and document processes effectively
Familiar and curious about marketing AI tooling
Interest in contributing to data pipelines that transform unstructured raw data into tables ready for analysis
Independent and varied role within an entrepreneurial and innovative organization
Bonus scheme (up to 1 gross monthly salary per year)
Nothing of value should be lost

In a world where overconsumption is a threat, TBAuctions finds it important to extend the life of products as long as possible. So, nothing of value should be lost. Our online intelligent auction platform makes this happen. By using data and a smart system we match supply and demand of used industrial products. Together with our auction brands (Troostwijk Auctions, Surplex Klaravik, Auksjonen, British Medical Auctions, PS Auction and Vavato ) we bring sustainable trade to a higher level. With buyers and sellers all over the world millions of products are auctioned every year.

Auctioning is trendy and the way to buy and sell. We are fascinated by technology, with a love for user-friendliness and the drive to preserve value. Do you share this drive and do you want to work for a company that has the ambition and the firepower to become the largest online auction platform in Europe? Apply for this vacancy!

At TBAuctions, we are committed to driving our online auction platform using data. We aim to understand the key drivers, measure our performance, predict future trends, and initiate improvements and innovations based on our insights. TBAuctions contains out of various brands which gain from insights to create better strategy and general decision making .


As a Marketing Data &
column2:
Insights Analyst with continental focus, your analytical mind and passion for data make you the perfect candidate to proactively provide the business with relevant and actionable insights. You will achieve this by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting the right data and translating it into meaningful conclusions. This role main focus in 2025 is setting up marketing report across brands, generate insights which can be acted on.


Based in Amsterdam, with regular travel to Dusseldorf and occasional travel to other European countries, you will report to marketing director and collaborate with the brand marketing teams and the group data team.


This is what you will do:

  • Collaborate with various teams in marketing across brands, and group marketing providing them with insights to better understand and explain their business.
  • Build and manage KPI dashboards that other teams like performance marketing rely on for decision-making
  • Analyze existing data to uncover trends and actionable insights with attention to detail.
  • Communicate your findings to the rest of the company and drive change in the product and our proposition. Insights are valuable, but the impact is even better!

What you will bring

  • Familiar with concept as attribution and ROI
  • Ability to identify product and business opportunities through data and clearly communicate them to colleagues.
  • Familiar with tooling as Google Analytics, Segment etc.
